quote: I saw a small ship disappear... I followed it...
That was one of our patrol vessels... you've travelled almost ninety- thousand light years. What planet do you come from?
How long does it last -- this anomaly?
The wormhole? It's stable... you can return whenever you want to. In the meantime, you're welcome to dock here and we'll try to answer all your questions...
No. No time...
Inertial stress is overloading his structural capacity.
Prepare to transport him off his ship.
I will not abandon my vessel.
Sir, your ship is in danger of...
I will not leave!
We can use a tractor beam to tow him in. The beam's graviton field should shore up the structural integrity.
Do it.
Cut your engines.
Why?
So I can save your ship, friend. We'll bring you in... try to fix you up good as new...
(soothing, talking him down) Good... engaging tractor beam... steady now... you feel the graviton field taking hold?
Yes.
You'll be fine now... just relax and enjoy the ride...
I'd say that's a man who doesn't know how to relax... He could use some of your meditation exercises, Lieutenant...
So could you, Major. Benjamin, I think we might want to skip formal first contact procedures for now...
Agreed. Why don't you meet him by yourself at the airlock, Mister O'Brien... he might find that a little less intimidating...
Aye, sir...
... And if you can, find out what he's so... nervous about...
O'Brien to Ops...
Go ahead, Chief.
You didn't beam this fellow out when I wasn't looking, did you?
Negative.
Well, he's not in here.
The sensors say he's still on board, Chief.
Friend, if you're in here... you've got nothing to worry about from me... you understand?
I'm just going to look at your ship... see what the problem is, okay... ?
Now, just so you know... I'm an engineer... I know a little bit about ships... well, more than a little bit actually...
(reacting to what he sees) Though to be sure, I've never seen anything close to this...
All right, not... is that some sort of plasma injector there... okay... then that would have to be an off- axis field controller of some kind... uh-huh... uh-huh...
The coladrium flow has been damaged.
Ah!
You can't go sneaking up on someone like that, friend... it's an Alpha quadrant rule...
Can it be fixed?
Well, that depends...
Depends?
On what exactly a coladrium flow is...
On my world, it would be simple... with proper materials I could do this myself...
Now, hang on, I didn't say we couldn't figure it out... you're just going to have to teach me as we go... I'm sure that...
I have no time!
I know... everybody's in a hurry these days... we'll get you on your way as soon as it's humanly possibly... Oh, that's me, by the way... human species, name of O'Brien...
Oh. Brien.
Miles O'Brien, Chief of Operations. How about you?
I am... Tosk.
That's your name? Or you... species... ?
I am Tosk.
Tosk, it is. (moving toward the exit) Come on, then...
There's nothing to be worried about out there. We've got to let your reactor cool down before we can do anything else anyway...
Now, Tosk, you know you've got a broken... uh, coladrium flow... and those aren't fixed overnight are they...
No reason to just sit in here. We've got a room for you. Probably not as nice as you're used to. But it'll do for now...
C'mon... I have work to do...
So what happened to you, anyway? Looks like you took some sort of shot to your hull.
The passage... through the anomaly was very rough.
Yeah, the wormhole can shake you up all right.
Security sensor... screens for weapons... it's just picking up my phaser... you're fine...
You wear a weapon?

Defensive purposes only. It may not seem hospitable. But going into an alien ship for the first time, you never know what might be inside... may even be someone who can turn himself invisible... know what I mean?
I understand.
A health center... ?
Yeah. That's Doctor Bashir... he looks after all our medical needs...
How many live here?
Oh, three hundred more or less...
What is its purpose?
Purpose?
Defense? Surveillance?

Well, sometimes when I walk along here, I think we're the flea market to the sector... I guess you could say our real job is to keep an eye on the wormhole... traffic goes in and out all the time now...
Many ships dock here?
Well, five or six a week... sometimes we get a whole convoy on its way through the wormhole... But you have the honor of being the first visitor from the other side...
Others will detect ships from your quadrant as I did... and follow them here...
We hop so. Our mission as Starfleet officers... is to seek out new lifeforms... so we can learn about one another...

Madame, I distinctly saw you move your wager to the green line after the play was completed... I will return your currency but you will promptly leave the establishment... you are no longer welcome...
Well, there are a few things to learn about us that can wait...
How about you? Are you... an explorer... a scientist... ?
I am Tosk.
Right.
Computer, lights...
I wasn't the decorator.
I wish to begin work on my ship.
We'll get started as soon as we can... Now, why don't you get some rest...
I require only seventeen minutes of sleep per rotation.
Seventeen... no kidding... if I don't get a good eight hours a night, I'm not the same man... are you hungry?
Hungry?
You know, do you want something to eat, take in sustenance...
Liquid nutrients have been stored in plasmic fibers throughout my body...
Well, the food replicator is over here if you change your mind... we've finally got it making a pretty good bowl of oatmeal. Just ask the computer for anything else you need.
Oh Brien. Thank-you.
As the Vulcans say, we're here to serve.
Computer... ?
State request.
May I see a... display of this facility?
Specifiy exterior or interior display.
Interior.
Interior display available in nineteen sections. Specify requirements.
Show me where the weapons are stored.
Habitat Ring, Level Five, Section Three. Access restricted to security clearance seven and above.
It's hard to say, sir... he is an alien and you hate to prejudge anyone...
What're you thinking, Chief?
Well, there's an old saying back home... "a man who's always lookin' over his shoulder is waiting for trouble to find him." (Research: a real Irish saying to replace this would be nice.)
You think he's on the run... ?

I'll tell you this -- he wasn't telling the whole truth about the damage to his ship... it sure wasn't caused by the wormhole. Somebody took a shot at him... came in at a 45 degree angle to the hull... sliced through two propulsion systems... I'll know more when I get a better look...
Stay with him as much as possible while he's here... I'll tell Odo to keep an eye on him too...
Aye, sir...
No... the coladrium flows through the Arva Nodes...
Uh-uh... and where's that...
The Arva Nodes... here...
These coils... ?
What are they... some kind of high- energy magnetic coils?
scene: 23   INT. HULL - DARK TIGHT TWO SHOT

quote: Ah... for fuel replenishment... fuel... ?
scene: 23   INT. HULL - DARK TIGHT TWO SHOT

quote: Like a ramscoop...
scene: 23   INT. HULL - DARK TIGHT TWO SHOT

quote: Ramscoop... ?
scene: 23   INT. HULL - DARK TIGHT TWO SHOT

quote: To capture stellar gases and convert them into usable fuel...
scene: 23   INT. HULL - DARK TIGHT TWO SHOT

quote: Yes! The Arva Nodes convert space matter into fuel!
scene: 23   INT. HULL - DARK TIGHT TWO SHOT

quote: Gotcha. Piece of cake.
scene: 23   INT. HULL - DARK TIGHT TWO SHOT

quote: (with misplaced confidence) Pieceofcake. Ramscoop. Arva Nodes.
scene: 23   INT. HULL - DARK TIGHT TWO SHOT

quote: Ah, "piece of cake" - it's just an old human expression. Means they'll be easy to fix.
scene: 23   INT. HULL - DARK TIGHT TWO SHOT

quote: They will be easy to fix?
scene: 23   INT. HULL - DARK TIGHT TWO SHOT

quote: Sure, we'll just get my crew to remove your Arva Nodes, then we'll take them over to the replicator center and make new ones...
scene: 23   INT. HULL - DARK TIGHT TWO SHOT

quote: Piece of cake.
scene: 23   INT. HULL - DARK TIGHT TWO SHOT

quote: How long?
Maybe a day or two. We'll want to run some tests after we have the replacement unit in...
No. No time for that.
Hey, I let you take this unit out without proper testing...
it breaks down and you blame me... next thing I know my work has a bad reputation in the Gamma quadrant...
I would not blame you.
I'm joking, Tosk.
I cannot tell. Oh Brien.

Sorry. It's just in my nature. And you're the most natural straight man I've met in ages... c'mon, while the fellas are working here, I'll buy you a drink... and you can tell me why you're in such a rush...
Nothing like this exists on my world.
This is where we do most of our R and R...
What is R and R...
Rest and relaxation. You know, down time. When we're not working.
You sleep a full third of your rotation. You rest and relax while you are awake. The Alpha quadrant has too much... "down" time.
My wife would laugh at that. She's barely seen me in the last three weeks.
We are very different, Tosk and Oh Brien.
I've noticed. Hey barkeep!
Don't call me "barkeep." I am not a barkeep. I am your host, the proprietor, a sympathetic ear to the wretched souls who pass through these portals...
... And a man who will exploit any vice you may have. Two synthales, barkeep.
I am sorry, I have no vices for you to exploit.
A challenge.
Tosk is our first guest from the Gamma Quadrant, Quark. I'd take him at his work.
Perhaps a short adventure in a holosuite...
Holosuite... ?
A fantasy encounter with danger, romance, thrills... created for your personal entertainment by the Quark Brothers...
I have no use for fantasy adventure. I live the greatest adventure one could ever desire.
Then, I envy you, Mister Tosk.
What are you talking about, Tosk... what is this adventure you're on?
I cannot discuss it.
Oh. Sure, of course. (long beat, irresistible) I mean, by the way you act, it's some kind of dangerous adventure, am I right?
I cannot discuss it.
Sure. Sorry.
(the answer to your question) Yes.
Dangerous.
I am Tosk.
Sounds like you've changed your mind about him, Chief...
Not exactly. I mean, he's running from something... that's for sure... and he's in danger... and he can't or won't talk about it...
People tell doctors things they never tell any one else... if you could talk him into having a routine medical examination, maybe I could...

(ignoring and interrupting Bashir) The thing is... I kind of like the guy... I'm not even sure why... in a way, he's almost naive... I guess any one would be in an alien environment... but... I don't sense a thread of criminal intent or dishonesty about him...
I thought you said he lied about the damage to his ship...
Well, he didn't exactly lie...
But he didn't exactly tell the truth either...
He keeps the truth pretty much to himself.
When will his ship be ready?
Tomorrow.
I don't see that we have much of a choice. We can't hold him. If he wants to tell you the truth, fine. If not, wish him well... and send him on his way...
Just what do you think you're doing?
Computer, seal off corridor fourteen A, habitat level five...
Seal confirmed.
Security to habitat five-fourteen- A...
When you get tired of bouncing off forcefields, we'll talk... all right?
I've done nothing to you.
It's that security junction I'm curious about.
I must prepare.
For what.
I cannot discuss it. I am Tosk.
I'm sure you are. Why don't we go down to my office while your friend Chief O'Brien takes a look to see just what you were doing in there...
Oh Brien.
Right. I'm going to release the forcefields now... I don't need a fight from you... understand?
I will not fight you...
Good. Computer, release the security seals...
I cannot discuss it.
... And I can't accept that as an answer...
I did nothing to you.
You were tampering with the security grid... I consider that a threat...
I think he was trying to shut down the lock-outs to Section Three...
The weapons locker...
What were you going to do with the weapons?
Are you wanted by authorities somewhere in the Gamma Quadrant?
Wanted?
Have you committed crimes?
(shocked at the accusation) Never. I am Tosk.
What does that mean? Is that supposed to explain all this?
It is all I can say.
Tosk, don't you think we deserve some answers?
What should I do with him?
Hold him for now. We'll wait to see if someone shows up looking for him.
Enough of this craziness, Tosk... tell me what the hell you were doing...
Oh Brien. You must let me out.
Tell me!
Allow me to die with honor.
Die? Who would want to kill you, Tosk?
Allow me to die with honor.
He's climbing the walls... like a trapped animal...
Sorry our jail cells aren't to his liking.
Somehow, I feel responsible.
You do... ?
Yeah. I guess I kinda adopted him. Talked him into coming on board...
You didn't talk him into breaking into the security system...
I just feel sorry for him. Somehow, I don't think he means us any harm.
What the hell is his secret?
Sensors are reading ionized "L"-band emissions... The patterns match Tosk's ship...
Hail them. Maybe we'll finally get a few answers...
No response.
Again. Rotate frequencies.
It's a modulated particle beam... we're being scanned...
Ready shields.
Not yet, Major... let them have a good look at us...
I'm reading phased power fluctuations... they may be readying a transporter of some kind...
Now, Major...
Shields up...
Open all hailing channels...
Open.
This is Commander Benjamin Sisko of the United...
They're bombarding our shields with some kind of radiation I've never see before... very rapid magnetic flux variations...
Red alert.
What the... they've inverted the amplitude on our shields...
I'm picking up transporter locks... they're beaming on board...
Location.
Promenade.
Security to the Promenade. Kira, O'Brien with me. Dax, you have Ops.
Ready phasers...
I am the Commander of this station. Put down your weapons...
Increase setting to level six...
It's that Tosk they're after.
Maybe they have a right to him...
Nobody's abducting a prisoner out of my brig as long as I'm alive, Major.
You may need this...
Thanks anyway, I don't use them.
I have Tosk... alive.
It is over.
What a disappointment... after such an entertaining beginning...
Entertaining... ?
These aliens gave us a great deal of resistance... we wondered how you got their cooperation without violating your oath of silence...
I told them nothing.
But, to see you here, caged and helpless... how could you allow this?
It is a disgrace to all Tosk. And the most disappointing hunt in memory...
You're saying that this whole thing... is a hunt... and Tosk is the prey...

You are right... this Tosk is unworthy of such a noble description. For this dishonor, you will endure the greatest humiliation Tosk can know... to be captured and brought home alive. You will live out your existence on public display... where children will make fun of you and toss you scraps of food...
Release him.

You've disrupted life on this station... for the pleasure of your... "hunt"... I'm not inclined to take any orders from you. Odo, watch the prisoner while our "guest" and I discuss this matter in private... ... unless you intend to take him by force... in which case I am prepared to give orders to open fire on your ship...
Over this Tosk?
... Have you nothing like this in your own society?
Centuries ago, people on my world engaged in bloodsports... killing lower species for pleasure. A few cultures still do. But even they wouldn't consider hunting a sentient being...

(casual, obvious to him) He is only sentient because we have made him sentient. He has been bred for the hunt. His entire reason to exist is the hunt... to make it as interesting, as exciting as he can. Obviously, you do not comprehend...
I comprehend just fine. I have no tolerance for the abuse of any lifeform.
Abuse? We honor Tosk. They are the symbol of all that is noble and courageous. They train and condition themselves all their lives for this event. They are proud of their role in our culture.
I can't judge what is right and wrong for your world. But on this station...
In the future, passage through the anomaly will be considered out of bounds for the hunt... will that satisfy you?
Now, you will arrange for the release of the Tosk.
I've agreed to release him.
But sir, Tosk is a living, intelligent being...
This is their custom, Chief... under the prime directive, we have no right to interfere...
What if Tosk were to request asylum?
If he asks for it...
All right, I have a way out for you...
A way... out. Of here?
Request asylum.
Asylum.
Ask for the protection of the Federation. Do you understand? My Commander is willing to protect you.
Oh Brien. I am Tosk. I cannot hide here behind the protection of your Federation. It is against everything I believe.
You'd rather go back and live in a cage on public display... ?
To stay would be a greater dishonor. I am Tosk, the hunted.

I live to outwit the hunters... for another day... to survive until I die with honor. Now that will not be my fate. But I will not deny my existence as Tosk. Thank-you, Oh Brien but I cannot request... asylum.
So far, I'm not impressed with the tourist trade from the Gamma Quadrant... not one of them has bought a single drink...
Shut up, Quark.
(beat, a sympathetic shoulder) More trouble with the little woman...
What's that supposed to mean?
Nothing... nothing... I just thought you might want to talk...
... there's nothing wrong between me and my wife and if there was, I sure as hell wouldn't talk about it to some barkeep...
Sorry. My mistake.
What?
Your face gets very pink when you're aggravated... much more so than most other hew-mans...
Then stop aggravating me!
No... no... no... no... not me. You came in the door this way.
Fine. You're right. I'm... aggravated.
I'm a keen observer of behavior. Want to talk about it?
No.
Why not?
Because talking to you won't help anything.
Try me.
Forget it. It's just the rules of the game.
Uh-huh. Uh-huh. Rules of the game. Go on.

It's a damn hunt, didja know that... they're chasing Tosk in a hunt... and everybody's playing by the rules... they're playing by their rules, we're playing by ours... and he gets caught in the middle...
(has no idea what O'Brien is talking about) Uh-huh.
Of course, I suppose when the Ferengi don't like the rules... they just change them...
Well, rules... rules are always subject to inter--...
Of course... change the rules... why didn't I think of that...
Thanks, barkeep.
So what's bothering you today?
Computer, access power grid to security check point four on the Promenade...
That isn't necessary.
Our ritual requires it when a Tosk is captured alive.
All right... let's go...
I'll be escorting the prisoner to the transporter station.
This is a security matter...
This is a Starfleet matter. Orders from Sisko.
We'll see about that.
Do not trouble yourself. My ship can transport us.

Nossir, that won't be necessary. Good relations with other cultures is our highest priority. Commander Sisko wants to make sure you understand we're sorry we interfered with your hunt. The least we can do is give you an official escort off the station... it's a token of goodwill and respect in our society...
Very well.
Starfleet has no business taking charge of a prisoner transport...
Calm down, Constable... what are you talking about...
I'm talking about your ordering O'Brien to escort Tosk off the station...
I didn't give him any orders at all...
Sisko to O'Brien...
Mister O'Brien, report to Ops immediately.
scene: 85   INT. SECURITY - CLOSE ON THE COMBADGE

quote: This way...
Glass jaw. Now, I know why you wear a helmet.
Up there!
The hunt has resumed!
Security reports a fight in the Promenade... apparently O'Brien set him loose...

I'm showing someone in an access conduit above Quark's... two lifeforms... one's human... (she exchanges a glance with Sisko, that means it's O'Brien and Tosk) ... they're heading out toward the docking ring...
I'll seal off the adjoining corridors... they won't get far...
Constable...
There's no hurry.
You are Tosk as well now, Oh Brien...
The Cardies made these conduits out of two-meter thick duranium composite... I've never seen a scanning device that could penetrate it...
... until now.
C'mon, Tosk, just around that corner... and we're there...
No. He's mine.
What happens now?
The hunt goes on.
You wish to come?
No... no... I don't think so... one day as a Tosk is enough for me... and I have a wife and kid that wouldn't fit too well into this lifestyle...
Will your Federation punish you for helping me?
Maybe. But if I know my Commander... Hell, those guys wanted a hunt. I just gave them one.
Go on, you better get out of here while you can...
(a formal Tosk good- bye) Die with honor, Oh Brien.
Die with honor, Tosk.
Just what did happen at that security checkpoint, Chief...
The weapons' sensors must have overloaded on all his various gear, sir.
"Must have"?
Yessir. They must have... since... I increased their output by about two hundred percent...
So... in effect you assaulted him... Our first contact with a new species.
Yessir.

We've got dozens of top level officials back at Starfleet Command, eagerly waiting to hear about our encounter with the first new lifeforms to come through the wormhole... how do you suggest I write up this report?

Well, sir... I'm not one to say. But you know, these... hunters weren't any happier than we were about having to bring Tosk home... and it seems in the interests of mutual understanding and future relations...
Save it.

You ignored your duty to Starfleet... you took off your combadge so you could ignore me... you even ignored the Prime Directive by interfering in their damned hunt. Another stunt like this and your wife won't have to complain about the conditions here anymore. Do I make myself clear?
I understand.
I was surprised by one thing, sir.
What's that?

I knew I couldn't override all the security seals on the station.. I figured once you and the Constable located us... well, that it would be over... we'd find ourselves locked behind a forcefield somewhere...
I guess that one got by us.
Yessir. Thank-you, sir.
Dismissed.
The usual, Odo?
Nothing.
The usual.
If all my customers were like you, my family would be begging on the Promenade.
Oh, I seriously doubt that. Not as long as there's a Miradorn raider for you to do business with.
Raider? You mean the Miradorn ship that just docked?
The raider.
It's reputation, like mine, has probably been exaggerated. Anyway, I don't know the ship or its crew.
You didn't make your usual welcome call inviting them in for a free drink?
Miradorns are a quarrelsome people. I chose to forego the usual amenities.
He looks away whenever I make eye contact.
Who?
The new arrival. The one the Klingons brought back from the Gamma Quadrant.
Croden? He's harmless.
Really. How is it you've come to know him so well... ?
A man comes in for a drink... he wants to talk...
He didn't seem to want to talk much to Sisko when he arrived...
Who would? All those Starfleet officers greeting him at the airlock. It would scare me too. The Federation could learn a few things from the Ferengi about hospitality.
They scared him, huh... ?
... of course...
... I wonder what he has to be scared about...
Well now! I believe a pair of twinned Miradorns just nodded your way.
I'm the man behind the bar. Obviously, they want to use a holosuite.
You think the whole galaxy is plotting around you, don'tcha... paranoia must run in your species, Odo... maybe that's why no one's ever seen another shape-shifter... they're all hiding.
Well, I won't have you coming here harassing my customers... order a drink, play the tables or vacate the premises.
Rom -- bring a flask of my special langour.
One-thousand bars of gold press latinum.
Non-negotiable.
Very nice.
Unfortunately, there's a problem.
Problem?
Langour, anyone?
What problem?
The buyer backed out.
You guaranteed us a buyer.
A question's been raised about the origin of this bauble. A similar item was taken during a raid on a Vanoben transport just two light years from here. If you had a bill of sale...
You didn't ask for any bill of sale when we contacted you...
Gentlemen, gentlemen please... try some rare Cardassian Langour, it will sooth you...
You will find another buyer...
A buyer who will ask no questions... that could take a long time...
We don't have a long time.
What's this?
Don't fire. What do you want?
No one will be hurt. Just give me... ...that...
You're making a mistake.
It wouldn't be my first. And probably won't be my last. Give it to me.
Security and medical to holosuite one.
Five glasses... for four people... ?
He's dead. My brother...
Take them all to my office.
Yes, take them both to his office. Thank goodness, you were... close by, Odo...
All of them...
Have you known any twinned Miradorn, Commander?
I'm afraid I haven't met any before now.
In my species, we are not just twin brothers... together we are a self... two halves of one being. I am incomplete now.
You should have considered the risks before trying to sell stolen merchandise.
You have no proof...
Two people were killed on the transport this object was taken from...
My brother and I purchased it from an Altoran trader...
His name... his ship's identification...
I am the one whose brother was killed, Commander...
You have only yourself to...
I'd like you to return to your ship for now. You have my sympathies. But there may be more questions... Please don't leave the station.
I want to deal with the one who killed my twin.
The law will deal with him.
My only purpose in life from here on is to see him dead.
Well, can't say I didn't warn you about Miradorns, Odo... I assume we're free to go... ?
Have you got enough evidence to hold them, Constable?
As Odo will be happy to confirm, I was just as concerned as everyone else that this was a stolen objet d'art.
Yes, curious... but it's true.
We'll be on our way then...
You know what else was curious... Croden had a Ferengi phaser...
Available in many a port.
And it's curious that he knew the Miradorn were trying to sell you something of value.
How dare you suggest that my brother set up this robbery!
What an interesting theory, Rom.
If that "theory" should ever get to the Miradorn...
... I'd wake up dead one morning. So, I'd appreciate your not spreading wild theories around casually...
I better have a talk with your prisoner, Constable...
Don't you feed your prisoners?
The fact that you killed a man doesn't affect your appetite?
It was him or me. If he killed me, I wouldn't be hungry now.

I want to be sure you understand what's going to happen. A trial will be held to determine your guilt or innocence. We can assign an advocate to defend you or you can request one from your home world.
I doubt that anyone on Rakhar would care.
Really. Isn't murder considered a serious crime where you come from?
On Rakhar, all crimes are serious... but there are no trials.
It's a shame our first encounter with your species has to take place under these circumstances.
Sorry if I made things awkward. I didn't have much choice.
Why not?
My needs exceed my skills. Now, if I had... ... his talents, I'd have no problems at all... I've never heard of a changeling with such versatility.
A what?
A changeling. Like you.
You've heard of other shape-shifters in the Gamma Quadrant?
Haven't they come through the wormhole yet? I assumed when I saw you...
He's lying. He heard me talking in the bar to Quark...
Well, maybe I dissemble a little. "Lie" is a hard word. But shape- shifters are harsh in their judgements.
Feed me... and maybe I'll tell you where I met someone just like... you...
I don't see that we have any choice. We have to contact his planet...
Not the best way of introducing ourselves...
Homicide as a means to open relations... not exactly how they teach it at the academy, is it...
I think you're all wrong... They're going to thank us...
Thank us?
That's what I'd do. He's probably committed all sorts of crimes in their system... they'll be glad that we've taken a problem off their hands.
There's only way to find out... Dax?
It won't be hard to find Rakhar. According to the logs, Croden was picked up in a damaged shuttlecraft about three light years from the wormhole. There aren't many M class planets in that area.
You're with me. Major, as long as the Miradorn ship is here, there's a threat to Croden... I don't want to have to tell his people that he was killed in our custody.
I'll have Odo increase security.
Stop in to see if I'd run away?
I couldn't get that lucky. That Croden is an interesting fellow.
I wouldn't know.
I never told you that. I merely said we chatted when he bought a drink or two.
I've talked to several people who saw the two of you engaged in heavy conversations... why Morn there said you even bought the fellow a meal...
Morn should keep his big mouth shut!
So what were you talking to him about...
Just being friendly. He was so out of place here; alone. I felt sorry for him. You should sympathize with my kindness.
There's no profit in kindness.
You attribute odious motives to my every charitable act.
That's because your favorite charity is your own pocket. Speaking of odious motives, I hear you've been making inquiries about securing a small ship to go through the wormhole.
That had nothing to do with any of this.
I think it did... I think you were trying to secure passage back to the Gamma Quadrant for Croden in exchange for staging this tragic little robbery of yours.
This could turn into a much bigger tragedy for me if you don't keep your voice down.
What did Croden tell you about himself?
Nothing. We didn't talk about anything except busi... ... inconsequential things.
What is inconsequential to you may be important to me. Did he say anything about his home world?
No.
Other species in the Gamma Quadrant?
No.
Security to Odo.
Go ahead.
Ah-Kel and his crew are blocking the entrance to your office. Should we clear them out?
Leave it. I'll handle them.
You were told to stay on your ship.
Understand me, shape-shifter. He killed the part of me that made existence bearable. I cannot stop until I kill him.
You're not killing anyone. Get back to your ship and stay there. If I find you here again, I'll lock you up too.
You've made a lot of friends in your short stay here.
I guess you'd know how that feels. You and I have a great deal in common, changeling.
We have nothing in common.
We're both aliens here, the only ones of our kind. Each of us is alone, isolated. Shut out. Others like us exist only in the Gamma Quadrant.
I've always wondered why changelings are so distrustful of other species...
I doubt the... changelings... on your world would trust you.
Of course not. There aren't any shape-shifters on Rakhar.
You just said... You implied there were.
I'm sorry if I misled you. There were shape-shifters on Rakhar at one time, but that was centuries ago.
What happened to them?
They were persecuted... driven out.
But I do know a place where there are still some left. At least, there were a few years ago.
And if you had the chance, you'd take me there.
Sure I would. Why not?
Tell me where it is and I'll go have a look.
I'd have to show you. There's no way you could get there on you own...
The next time you lie, I'll save Ah-Kel the trouble of killing you.
There's that hard word again. There are times I don't dissemble.
Whatever you call it, the truth isn't in you.
From the colony of changelings.
We're in orbit.
Open hailing frequencies...
Open...
This is the Federation Starship Rio Grande attempting to make contact with the planet Rakhar. Please respond.
One of your people has committed a homicide and we have him in custody. His name is Croden.
I'm picking up a signal from the southern hemisphere... they're hailing us...
On screen...
I am the Exarch of Nehelik Province. You will transport Croden to this location.
I'm afraid we didn't bring him with us.
Your communication clearly stated that he was in your custody...
On our space station... perhaps, I should explain where we come from...
We are well aware of the traffic through the newly discovered passage... We simply have no interest in contact with anyone from your quadrant...
I'm sorry to hear that, but we'll certainly respect your wishes. We just felt it necessary after Croden was arrested...
Croden is an enemy of the Rakhari people... we request that he be returned immediately...
He's scheduled to be tried for his crime on our space station...

Tried? Croden has already been declared guilty in absentia for myriad crimes on this world. That judgement supersedes your charges. Return him and I can assure you his punishment will be appropriate to your crime as well as ours.
I would be more comfortable if we could...
I do not know what kind of people you are. I do not care to know. But if your society purports to respect the rules of our society, you will return him without delay.
You can expect him to arrive in another vessel like this one within fifty-two hours.
It's an amalgam of organic material and some sort of crystal.
You mean it's alive?
More or less. It's almost like a transitional stage between organic and inorganic matter. I've only seen one life form that even remotely resembles it.
Me.
In a way, this stone might qualify as a distant cousin of yours. Maybe there's a clue to your origins here. Where did it come from?
Unfortunately, the only one who can tell me is less reliable than Quark.
How'd you like my "stone," changeling?
Where'd you get it?
What does telling you get me?
Nothing.
Too bad. I thought you might feel sorry for me... seeing we're the only two here from the other side of the passage...
I feel nothing for you but contempt... you're a thief and a killer and who knows what else...
Typical.
Of "changeling" behavior... yes, I'm sure...
Excuse me...
In my sector, there is a nebula called the Chamra Vortex. There are millions of asteroids there. This "stone" came from one of them. I can take you to it, changeling.
Others must know where it is.
No. The Vortex is uncharted. But as a thief and a killer and who knows what else, I hid there often. I found this changeling colony by chance but... I know my way back...
Yes, Commander...
I want you to escort the prisoner back to his home planet.
He's not to stand trial here?
Croden apparently committed crimes on Rakhar. His government was adamant and the Bajorans have agreed to release him.
We're going to have trouble getting him by the Miradorn.
Yes, I know... Ah-Kel's been screening every ship leaving the station. How soon can you be ready?
I'm ready now.
There's a Rigelian freighter leaving here for the Gamma Quadrant in an hour... maybe we can use them to run interference between you and the Miradorn ship...
I'll move the prisoner to the Runabout right away.
Constable, once you're on the other side, you'll be on your own... the
Understood.
(looks around at the Runabout) So you finally decided to take me up on my offer.
You're going home.
The Rigelian Freighter is ready to depart.
Signal Odo.
The Miradorn ship's scanning the freighter... doesn't look like they're reading the Runabout...
How do you stand it, changeling? Living where you don't belong. Are you happy?
I'm as much a part of the place as anyone else.
I doubt it. They tolerate you, but you're not one of them. Being what you are, you can pour your square shape into a round hole... but you never really fit, do you? You're like my stone.
I think I finally figured out what crime you were found guilty of on your world...
What's that?
You talked too much.
Maybe you're right. Perhaps that is how it started. Perhaps I asked one question too many... That's as good an explanation as any...
Explanation for what?
For why they came that night. I never was told. And to this day, I don't know. They broke into my home just before dawn. By the time I stopped them, they had already murdered both my wives...

You see, on my world, the punishment for being an enemy of the people is the death of your family. I had no sophisticated weapon... only a short, slaughter knife that I used for cutting the necks of fowl we would prepare for supper. Imagine my surprise when I discovered that the necks of the security officers were no more difficult to cut than the birds'... even the sounds they made when the blade crossed their gullets were similar...
I'm supposed to believe this appalling tale...
Would it make a difference if you did?
No.
Then believe it. Because it's true.
My return will be celebrated, changeling... they'll be grateful... you'll be a hero. Perhaps you can even use this as an excuse to exchange envoys...
If you don't stop talking, I can sedate you for the rest of the trip.
Sorry. I didn't know I bothered you.
He's going to kill us. He says we were in with Croden.
Where is he, Quark?
Croden? He's in security.
Don't lie to me. He's gone.
You're hiding him. You've been in it together all along. You're as responsible for my brother's death as he is.
Ah-Kel, no. This is Odo's doing. Don't you see? He wants to turn us against each other.
Why should I believe you? Tell me where Croden is, or you can die in his place.
I don't know where he is. But maybe I can find out... if you will just release me...
Get me the security chips...
Level four clearance.
There. Station logs. Odo logged out in a Runabout at oh- eight-hundred. Destination... Rakhar.
Give me the coordinates.
Ah, I don't think... it isn't at all clear...
The coordinates are very clearly stated... right here in the log entry.
One more thing, little Ferengi. You better be telling the truth or I'll be back to finish this.
Oh, you are clever, brother. Now, Ah-Kel will rid us of Croden and Odo.
Unless Odo is sensible and gives up his prisoner.
Oh no! Then Croden would tell Ah- Kel the truth about our plan... we're dead... we're dead... you shouldn't have told him how to find them...
Be quiet. Odo won't give up his prisoner. He'll just get himself killed.
Do you really think so?
Oh, get out of here, you fool!
Yes, Chief... ?
The Miradorn ship is leaving the station.
Major, do whatever you can to delay them...
Ops to Miradorn vessel... please hold your position... stand by for departure instructions...
No response... they're still moving...
Dax, how long before Odo reaches Rakhar?
Just over five hours...
Miradorn vessel, you are in violation of Bajoran transit regulations... please return at once to the docking ring...
They've increased power to their thrusters...
On screen...
You'd save time going through the Vortex. It's a long way around.
Aren't you the least bit curious about your own people?
Of course, I am. Unfortunately, I'm not at liberty to pursue that curiosity right now.
They don't maintain a humanoid shape, you know.

They refused to assimilate on my world... they're a very proud species... that's why they were so persecuted. But I will say this for them... they treated me well enough when I landed at their colony. I was badly wounded... they could have allowed me to die... they didn't. You're one of them... that's for sure... you have that sense of decency, of justice...
You don't give up, do you...
Computer, what was that...
A temporary loss of stability resulting from the impact of a concentrated plasma charge.
Concentrated plasma charge? You mean we were attacked.
Affirmative. Pursuing vessel approaching from one-eight-one mark one-two.
Put it on the monitor and identify...
Miradorn vessel, Theta class.
He's hailing us...
The first shot was a warning. You will surrender the Rakhari prisoner to me...
I don't give up my prisoners, Ah-Kel.
Very well. Then you can die with him.
Warning. Damage to shields...
Computer, evasive maneuvers!
Warning... shields at forty-one percent...
Your computer's not going to outsmart him...
I'm a security chief, not a combat pilot...
Then give me the controls...
You?
I know how to get us through the Vortex. The ionized gasses would screen us from his sensors.
Drop your suspicious nature for a minute, changeling. Can't you see it's our only chance.
Why are we slowing down?
The Vortex is riddled with volatile pockets of a gas we call toh-maire. If we destabilize them, they could ignite and blow this ship apart.
You really have been through here before.
Sometimes I do tell the truth.
How do you remember what's true and what isn't?
I thought you said they couldn't detect us in here.
Computer, disengage impulse engines... go to thrusters...
Acknowledged. Thrusters engaged.
What are you doing?
Once our impulse wake drops off, he might try to pick up the discharge from our thrusters... we'll be better off if we land... So, changeling, I guess I'm going to take you home after all...
This way...
Slow down, Croden... stay where I can see you... Croden...
What's your hurry? What's in here?
I told you... the colony...
Anxious to see them again are you...
Of course...
Come on...
Whatever you came here to get, you can forget it. We're leaving.
Odo...
Now!
How much of it was true? Any of it? Any of it?
No. On Rakhar, we tell stories about changelings. I thought they were a myth... until I met you.
The stone.
I don't know where it came from. Rakhari merchants buy stones like it from off-world traders. It's used as a key.
A key? To what.
My only reason to live. It's inside the cavern ahead.
Help me, there must have been a cave in...
What is it?
A stasis chamber.
My daughter. The only member of my family I could save.
It shapes itself to fit this lock.
Father?
I was dreaming about you.
I'm here, Yareth. You don't have to dream anymore.
Hello.
This is Odo. He's a security officer.
No, he won't hurt you. He'll take you to a place where you'll be safe. Won't you?
Where are you going?
Home.
But you can't... they'll kill you...
I have to answer for my crimes, Yareth...
All you did was try to protect us...
Their sensors must have picked up our life signs... we've got to get back to the Runabout... come on!
Odo!
Is he badly hurt?
It's hard to tell... I don't know anything about his species... I'll carry him aboard...
What's the matter, Father?
Nothing.
You're heavier than you look.
You could have left me behind.
Don't thank me. I already regret it.
I haven't been able to lose them. Sooner or later, one of his photons is going to trigger a toh-maire explosion... and kill us all...
Let me have the controls. Find us one of those toh-maire fields...
I just told you, you don't want to go anywhere near one, changeling. Sorry. Habit. It suits you.
Find the closest toh-maire field.
Six degrees to starboard.
Changing course... He's chased us everywhere else... maybe he'll follow us in there too...
His sensors may not be able to detect how volatile the field is. If he fires at us in there, the whole thing will ignite...
That's what I'm counting on...
Set a course along the interior perimeter...
Done.
Computer, shut down all engines...
Engines disengaged.
Maintain emergency readiness to re-engage impulse on my command...
We're an awfully easy target...
He's hailing us.
On screen.
Are you prepared to surrender your prisoner?

I have a full array of Starfleet weapons trained on you, Ah-Kel. Frankly, I don't know too much about them... but I hear they equip this little vessel with some pretty powerful stuff... so I suggest you withdraw while you still can...
There will barely be a trace of your little vessel when we're finished with you...
He's coming about... ... powering his shields... ... his starboard photon bank is armed...
Computer, engage!
Everybody back there in one piece?
Yes.
Good. Take us out of your precious vortex.
I only have one last favor to ask. Yareth is going to be alone in your world. Like you've always been. She's going to need someone to look after her...
If you're suggesting what I think you're suggesting...
Now, you know you could use some company, changeling... you may deny it, but we both know it's true... or this rock wouldn't have meant a thing to you...
Incoming subspace signal... Vulcan band frequency...
On screen.
Starfleet Runabout... this is the Vulcan Science Vessel T'Vran. Are you in any difficulty?
Chief of Security Odo from D.S. Nine. We're fine, Captain.
We detected a major eruption in the Chamra Vortex. I was afraid a small ship like yours might have suffered damage.
I appreciate your concern. What's your course?
To the wormhole, then home to Vulcan.
I beamed over two survivors from a ship that wasn't so lucky. I have a mission to complete. Could you give them transportation to Vulcan?
Easily done. We will rendezvous with you shortly. Prepare for transport.
Don't thank me. I already regret it.
How... how will you explain not delivering me?
I'll tell them you were killed when Ah-Kel torpedoed the asteroid. This dissembling must be catching. You'll have to get used to living in an alien society...
Like you. But I know where my home is. And perhaps someday, I'll be able to go back again.
I hope it will help you find where you came from.
T'Vran to Ganges. Ready for transport.
Are you really a changeling?
Yes. I suppose I am.
Go on, we don't want to keep the Vulcans waiting.
Energizing.
(beat, turns to controls) Computer, set a course for the wormhole.
Course laid in.
Ready engines.
Home. Where is it? Someday, we'll know... cousin. Engage.
Right there.
The explosion began in the intercooler matrix. Your men were supposed to put the bomb here...
, ... in the secondary plasma relay.
What difference does that make? The ship was still destroyed.
The intercooler's an obvious choice for sabotage. Their security checks could've found the bomb and disarmed it before the ship left orbit.
But they didn't find it.
That's not the point. Your men ignored their instructions and their training.
Let's not lose sight of the fact that the mission was a success.
It was a success because Jem'Hadar security slipped up and we got lucky. Don't use those men again for anything except routine reconnaissance.
They're five of my best men! Bronok is one of the most
You've been told before -- no names!
Every cell has to be insulated from the cell above and below.
If I know the names of your men and I'm captured...
I've heard the lecture.
Then you shouldn't have to be reminded!
It's been a long day. Why don't we take a break.
Good idea. The air in here is getting stale.
Are you going to do something
I am. I'm giving him my support.
All right.
That does not bode well.
Odo!

The raid on the Tevak shipyard was successful. I penetrated the Operations Center and disabled the security protocols. The rest of the team sabotaged the dilithium storage bunkers. An hour after we left, the entire facility was vaporized.
You should get some rest...
That sounds good to me...
Anyone in the bunkroom?
No.
It's all yours.
Odo... good work.
Thank you.
Starfleet Intelligence says that a contingent of Breen engineers arrived on Kelvas Five last week. Breen engineers... Have we had any reports of Breen ships in that system?
No. As a matter of fact, no Breen ships have been reported in that entire sector.
So why send engineers... ? Do you have any contacts on Kelvas Five?
No. But I think I know who might. Excuse me.
It's just like you to come sneaking in here without warning.
My approach may have been quiet, but I assure you, I had no intention of "sneaking" up on you. My apologies.
If I may ask... ?
Why have I... deteriorated so rapidly? I've been assuming dozens of different shapes over the past few weeks. Changing form seems to... accelerate the progress of the disease.
Perhaps you should stop.
And do what? Lie here and wait to die? No, thank you. I'm here to work and work is what I'm going to do.
I see. I take it that Commander Kira is unaware of your... true condition?
That's right. And I prefer that it stay that way.
I won't breath a word.
See that you don't. She has enough on her mind without worrying about me. And I don't want her...
Pity?
Is there a reason you came in here?
We have need of a contact on Kelvas Five. I remember you once mentioning that you knew several --
(wants this over with) I might have a few names for you, I'll have to give it some thought.
Odo... I hope you know how much I --
If I don't want pity from the woman I love, why would I want it from you?
DNA analysis complete.
Display results.
Morning.
What time is it?
Oh-six-thirty. Another all-night session? That's four in a row. You can't keep this up.
I'm beginning to agree with you... and to add insult to injury, I'm not getting anywhere. My DNA integration theory was another blind alley.
So where does that leave you?
Back to square one. Whoever engineered this Shape-shifter disease did a good job of covering their tracks.
Julian, it's time to face facts.
Miles...
We have to find a way to get inside Section Thirty-one.
We tried that. We tried and we tried and all we succeeded in doing was to waste two weeks chasing phantoms from here to Vulcan. You want to face facts?

Face this fact -- Section Thirty- one has managed to stay in the shadows for three hundred years. They're not going to suddenly come scurrying into the light just because Miles O'Brien and Julian Bashir are on the case!
Which is why I still say we should take this to Captain Sisko and let him contact Starfleet Intelligence. Maybe they can --

All that will do is alert Thirty- one to that fact that we're onto them. And you know what they'll do next? They'll go deeper into hiding and they'll probably send someone here to destroy what little headway I've made. No. No more cloak and dagger games. Science is the answer here. Every puzzle has a solution, every disease has a cure, it's just a matter of finding it.
Now, if you'll kindly get the
Martok's attack on Avenal Seven
General Martok and I both advised you against attacking a world so deep inside Dominion territory. He was outnumbered six to one at Avenal.
He didn't hide behind anything! He fought harder and longer than I would've in his place. Have you read Worf's after-action report?
Seven Klingon ships destroyed! Five others heavily damaged! And Martok himself is in critical condition in the Rotarran Sickbay.
He's expected to survive.

That's not the point. This whole operation was a waste of resources, men and equipment. The blame lies with the man who ordered the attack in the first place, not with the man who tried to carry it out.
That's one of the things I like about you, captain. Your loyalty
This has nothing to do with loyalty.

Of course not. In any case, you needn't worry. Martok's a... popular general with the troops. And that counts for something. I won't relieve him of command... yet. His flagship won't return to the station for three days. That should give me time to finalize plans for our next operation.
Chancellor, we can't afford to keep wasting ships in these reckless attacks!
I like a brave man, Captain... but not a foolish one. The soldiers of the Empire are mine to command. And if I say the attacks will continue... they continue.
... and as you can see, the Klingon raid on Avenal was easily broken up.

I am less concerned about a Klingon attack than I am about this Cardassian rebellion. We cannot fight the combined military forces of the Federation, the Klingons and the Romulans while facing a full- scale uprising behind the lines.
I completely agree. However, the situation is well in hand. We still control the Cardassian
He's correct. You also assured us that Damar would never turn against the Dominion.

That was an... error, to be sure. But an understandable one. No one could've foreseen that Damar would become a terrorist. The concept is antithetical to the very nature of Cardassians. They respect authority. They value the rule of law and the security of order -- which is exactly what the Dominion offers them.

If our cloning facilities were operational, I would eliminate this Weyoun immediately. Damar must pay a price for his treason. Redouble your efforts to locate his wife and children. Then begin interrogating Cardassian teachers, scientists, local officials... the population has to understand in no uncertain terms that dissent will not be tolerated. I also want to begin putting Cardassian civilians in and around Dominion military installations. If Damar destroys another shipyard, he'll have to kill a good number of his countrymen in order to do it... that should help turn the people against him.
An excellent plan.

Your opinion was not solicited. Thot Pran, the sooner we can regain the offensive on the front lines, the better. The installation of Breen weapons aboard Dominion ships should be accelerated. Please issue the appropriate orders to your engineers.
How long until the cloning facilities are operational again?
Not for... several days... perhaps even weeks.
Keep me informed.
... and according to our new contact on Kelvas Five, the Breen will begin installing their energy dampening weapons aboard Jem'Hadar fighters within a week.
Has the Federation made any progress on counteracting these weapons?
They're still having trouble understanding the underlying technology.
Why aren't the Klingon ships affected by these Breen weapons?
We don't know that yet either. But, if we could supply the Federation with one, it would give them a chance to come up with a countermeasure.
I had the same thought.
Our priority should be to free Cardassia from the Dominion, not to do Starfleet's dirty work.
We're all in this together. By helping Starfleet, we're helping ourselves.
There's a Cardassian repair facility in the Kelvas System, right?
Yes. I take it you have something in mind?

(still working it out in her head) It won't be easy... but if we can get onto the bridge... All right. We'll use a five-man team. The four of us, plus Odo. Garak, I'll need everything we have on the Kelvas facility.
Something wrong?
Possibly... could I have a few words with the commander...
What's on your mind?

It's about taking Odo on this mission... I'm afraid there's no easy way of putting this... he's been hiding the true extent of his illness from you for some time now. His condition has severely deteriorated. And the more he changes form, the worse it gets.
I know. I love him, Garak. You think I wouldn't notice?
Why the pretense?

Because I also know that he doesn't want me to find out about it. He wants to put up a brave front and protect me from the truth. Fine. If that makes this easier for him, if that gives him one last shred of dignity to hang onto, then I'll go on ignoring what's happening to him right up until... right up until the end. Anything else?
No.
All right... we're going to need a Cardassian shuttle with up-to-date security protocols...
Sisko to Worf.
Worf here.
I'd like to see you in my office, commander.
On my way.
How's Martok?
Doctor Bashir said he'll make a full recovery.
I'm glad to hear that. Mister Worf, we have a serious
Gowron.
He seems hell-bent on continuing these offensives regardless of the cost.
He is a stubborn, arrogant man.
That may be true, but he's not a fool. He's risking our entire defense posture. Why can't he see that?
I suspect the Chancellor cannot see anything at the moment... except for one man.
You mean Martok?
Gowron sees him as a political threat. These attacks against the Dominion are designed to humiliate Martok in the eyes of the Empire -- to force him to endure defeat after defeat.
Are you telling me this is a political vendetta?
It would not be the first time that a Klingon Chancellor put his own interests ahead of the greater good.
Something has to be done.
I agree. And I have a solution. But it will not be easy.
Understood.
My men have secured the shuttle. They'll meet us at those coordinates.
Good.
Are you enjoying yourself? Getting Cardassians to do your bidding must give you great satisfaction.
I'm a little busy right now, Rusot. Go find someone else to
You may have fooled Damar into believing that you're here to help fight the Dominion, but I know why you're really here.
This should be good.

You killed hundreds of Cardassians during the Occupation. Now you're getting a chance to do it again. That's why you're here, isn't it? To hang a few more Cardassian neckbones from your belt? Admit it, Kira -- you won't be satisfied until every one of us is dead.
I don't have time for this...
Don't you ever touch me again.
I guess I hit a nerve...
That's hitting a nerve, Rusot. Keep pushing me and you're going to find out just how many nerves your miserable body has.
When this is all over... and the Dominion is defeated...
You won't have any trouble finding me.
You'll have to do something about him long before that, commander.
Thanks for all your help.
You appeared to have things under control.
Despite his statement to the contrary, Rusot won't wait until the end of the war to make his move. I suggest that you not wait either. Kill him... before he kills you.
Challenge Gowron? In the middle of a war? It's treasonous! I won't do it.
Gowron is leading us all to ruin. It is your duty to challenge him to protect the Empire!
You would have me protect the Empire by breaking my oath... by spilling the blood of a Klingon brother while an enemy stands at our door? Where is the honor in that?
Gowron is sacrificing our troops for his own petty reasons. Where is the honor in that?
The troops are his to command, Worf. It is not our place to question him unless he acts with cowardice -- and there is no proof of that!
You are not listening!

I've heard every word you said. You want me to become Chancellor. Me. Tell me Worf, how do you think the members of the High Council will react when they're asked to follow a common man from the Ketha Lowlands? A man without a drop of noble blood in his veins?
Kahless himself was not high- born.
Kahless was divine.

Your name is revered throughout the Empire. If you seize the Leadership, every warrior from here to Kronos will swear an oath to you. With that kind of support, the High Council will have no choice but to accept you as chancellor.
You sound like a Romulan.
You know I'm right.

I am a loyal soldier of the Empire! I would rather die than dishonor my uniform by raising a hand to my chancellor in a time of war! I would bring shame to everything I have fought to protect! Everything I believe in.
General --
My decision is made and we will not speak of this again!
You're staring again.
Sorry. I just can't help... worrying about you.
Don't. It may be a long time before the first symptoms manifest themselves. And by then, I'm sure Doctor Bashir will have found a cure.
Right. Can you take the helm? I'm going to get some raktajino.
One of our listening posts picked up a message that... the Dominion has succeeded in locating Damar's family.
They're dead.
My wife and I... she was a difficult woman. Selfish. Stubborn. But she wasn't part of this rebellion. The Dominion knew that... the Founder knew that... Weyoun knew that. To kill her... and my son...
What kind of state tolerates the murder of innocent women and children? What kind of people give those orders?
Yeah, Damar, what kind of people give those orders?
That was stupid.
Not at all. Damar has a certain... romanticism about the past. He can use a dose of cold water.
I could've picked a better time.
If Damar is the man to lead a new Cardassia... if he's the man we hope him to be... then the pain of this news made him more receptive to what you said, not less.
We're approaching the rendezvous
The shuttle is here.
Right on time. Just as I promised.
Damar to shuttle. Lower your shields and we'll beam aboard.
Acknowledged. Shields down.
Let's go.
... and in truth, I understand his position. It is the duty of all soldiers to support their leaders in time of war. Asking Martok to stand against Gowron was a foolish error.
So what are you going to do?
Try to persuade Gowron to discontinue these attacks. You've said very little.
I'm a counselor. Most of my job is listening.
I'm not interested in counseling. I need something more useful. That's not what I meant.
I know what you meant. Look, I'm just not sure I should be giving you advice on what to do in this situation. This is a Klingon matter.
You're still a member of the House of Martok.
This is the first I've heard of it.
Martok and I discussed it weeks ago. He likes you. He thinks you're an honorable woman and a worthy successor to Jadzia. (casual, taking a drink) So do I.
That's very sweet of him... of both of you.
Sweet?
Not a very Klingon word is it?
No.
It's very... honorable.
Better. But a little obvious. Now, tell me what you think.
Okay. But, I'm not sure you're going to like it. I think the situation with Gowron is just a symptom of a deeper problem. The Klingon Empire is dying. And I think it deserves to die.
You're right. I don't like it.
Don't get me wrong, I'm really touched that you still consider me a member of the House of Martok... but I tend to look at the Empire

I see a society in deep denial about itself. We're talking about a warrior culture that prides itself on maintaining centuries-old traditions of honor and integrity... but in reality, it's willing to accept corruption at the highest level.
You're overstating your case.
Am I? Who was the last leader of the High Council that you respected? Has there even been one?

How many times have you had to help cover up the crimes of Klingon leaders because someone told you it was for the "good of the Empire?" I know this sounds harsh, but... the truth is, you've been willing to accept a government you know is corrupt. Gowron is just the latest example. Worf, you're one of the most honorable and decent men I've ever met... and if you're willing to tolerate men like Gowron, what hope is there for the Empire?
We have a prisoner for the Vorta in command of this ship.
Everything seems to be in order. But you will have to leave your weapons here.
Why?
New orders from Dominion Headquarters. No armed Cardassians allowed aboard Jem'Hadar vessels.
It sounds like they don't trust us anymore.
It's not your fault.
Do as he says. The three of us should be able to handle one Bajoran woman.
Take them to the bridge.
Good luck... Legate Damar.
... we'll run the first test firing in two hours, fourteen minutes. Agreed. Coordinate it with central operations.
What's this?
We have a prisoner.
I can see that. Why are you bringing her to me?
This is Commander Rota -- deputy intelligence officer for this entire sector. I would think you'd be interested in interrogating her.
I wasn't informed of this.
I'm sure the report hasn't reached you yet, but that's not surprising. We only took the commander prisoner yesterday.
Let me see your orders.
Of course.
Founder. You honor us with your presence. I had no idea you were in this sector.
My movements do not concern you.
No...
Ah. Commander Rota. Have you begun interrogating this prisoner?
Not yet.
Good. I will conduct the questioning myself.
As you wish.
I see the upgraded plasma rifles have been distributed. Let me inspect it.
Secure those hatches!
It wasn't necessary to kill them all!
We can't afford to be burdened with prisoners.
We'll argue about this later. Prepare to flood all decks below the bridge with neurazine gas. Bring the warp drive on-line and lay in a course for the Federation.
Commander!
They haven't finished installing the Breen weapon. We can't leave.
How long until they finish installing the weapon?
We can't wait!
We're not leaving without that weapon.
There are three -- no, four -- Breen working in the engine room. From the diagnostics, I'd say it'll take them... another thirty to forty-five minutes to complete their work...
We don't have that much time!
Yes, we do. No one even knows we're on the bridge. All we have to do is sit tight, send out the standard replies to any inquiries and wait for the Breen to finish their work.
Damar, this is insane. She'll get us all killed!
There's an incoming message. They want to speak with the Vorta.
Disable the visual feed.
What was her name?
Come on!
I'm looking... ah! Her name was Luaran.
This is Luaran. No, I can't see you either.
They want a status report on our navigational array.
I've got it.
The data is on its way. Excellent. We'll be repairing the com system for at least the next hour. I'll contact you when we're finished. Luaran out.
Then we're dead.
Hey.
Hey.
Keiko whipped up some crab rolls for you. She... we... thought you might be hungry.
Thanks. To both of you.
About the other day...
Forget it.
How's the work going?
I'm firmly entrenched in square one.
Hmm. Can I ask you a question -- about Thirty-one?
Go ahead.
If you do find the cure and they hear about it, what do you think they'll do?

Well... I would imagine that they'd be concerned. The very existence of a cure would jeopardize their entire plan to eradicate the Founders. So I wouldn't be surprised if Sloan or another operative suddenly showed up here on the station and tried to destroy my work.
What are you getting at?
I think you should send a message to Starfleet Medical saying that you have found the cure.
You're trying to lure someone from Section Thirty-one to the station...
That's right.
And once this operative gets here... ?
We capture him. Then, all we have to do is figure out a way to get some information out of him.
He may not know anything about the disease.
Maybe not... but I bet he'll know who does. So... what do you think?
I think... it's a good plan. A very good plan. When did you become so devious?
I think I've been around you too long. I'm starting to learn how to build wheels within wheels.
Not a bad skill for an engineer.
All the same, it's not one I'd like to perfect. Let's just hope this works and we can cure Odo -- that's all I care about.
Me too, Miles. Me too.
How much longer?
I'm not certain... they appear to be having trouble connecting the secondary relays...
Yes... don't worry... I'm...
Sorry...
There's nothing to be sorry about...
Stay with me, Odo. We're going to get out of here. Just hang on a little longer.
It's over.
Shut up, Rusot!
The Shape-shifter is useless. The whole plan is coming apart! We have to get out of here!
Go back to your post!
No! No, more! We're leaving now!
That would be unwise.
You're still a Cardassian, Garak. You're not going to kill one of your own people for a Bajoran woman.
How little you understand me.
Enough! Put your weapons down, both of you!
You want her dead too, Damar. I know you do. But you're the leader of the rebellion and you don't want to kill someone wearing a Starfleet uniform. Let me do it for you.
They've finished installing the dampening weapon.
Then let's all get the hell out
Not you.
(phaser never wavering) I'm still here, Rusot.

Damar, shoot him. We can kill them both and keep the Breen weapon for ourselves. I believe in you, Damar. I know you're the right man to restore the Empire we loyally served. The Empire we loved. Together we can lead our people to greatness again! Just aim and fire.
He was my friend. But his Cardassia is dead... and it won't be coming back.
Flood all compartments with the gas.
Clear all moorings. Bow thrusters ahead full.
We've cleared their defense perimeter.
Take the helm.
You're probably... angry...
Why?
I... hid my... true condition..
Odo... I've known all along.
But, it's not over. I'm sure Julian's working on a cure and --
Let's not... talk about it. Just... sit here with me.
All right.
Our next target... Sarpedion Five.
Sarpedion is the headquarters for the entire Twelfth Order.
Yes. You'll take fifteen Vorcha- class battle cruisers in first to soften their defenses. Then --
Chancellor. That world is one of
If you lack the courage to fight an uphill battle, then perhaps you should retire to your bed.
I will fight any battle, anywhere... for the Empire.
Spoken like a true warrior.
After Martok has softened their defenses --
No.
We cannot attack Sarpedion.
I decide what can and cannot be done.

You rule without wisdom and without honor. The warriors gathered here will not say this to you... but I will. You are squandering our ships and our lives in a petty act of vengeance. You do not care what happens to the Empire, you only care about Gowron.
I should've known better than to trust you again. If you were a true Klingon, I would kill you where you stand. Fortunately for you, that child's uniform shields you from your rightful fate.
What I say now, I say as a member of the House of Martok, not as a Starfleet officer... you have dishonored yourself and the Empire. You are not worthy of leading the Council.
There can be only one answer to that.
Worf, this is madness...
You will... not... have this... day...
Victory... is... mine...
Hail Worf! Leader of the Empire! Worf! Worf! Worf!
Worf! Worf! Worf! Worf!
Wait! Hear me!

What I have done... was for the Empire... not for me. A new day must dawn for our people... a day bright with the promise of restoring our honor and our dignity. I am not the man to usher in that day. But there is a man here who can.
Worf... I do not seek the leadership.
Kahless said, "Great men do not seek power, they have power thrust upon them."
Martok! Martok! Martok! Martok! Martok! Martok! etc.
A bottle of bloodwine and two mugs... I thought you hated bloodwine.
It's a special occasion.
Oh? Maybe I should join you.
Maybe not.
Maybe not.
To Chancellor Martok.
To Chancellor Worf.
My reign was... brief.
Kahless also said, "A leader is judged not by the length of his reign but by the decisions he makes." And your decision may have been one of the greatest in Klingon history. I'm proud of you, Worf.
So... how did it feel to stand on the mountaintop? To know that for that moment, the entire Klingon Empire lay at your feet?
In truth... all I could think of was my father. I wish he could've known that his son became chancellor... even if only for a moment.
I think he knows... and so does Jadzia.
To Chancellor Worf?
Sure I remember the Alamo.
I told you he would.
Laurence Harvey, Richard Widmark and John Wayne as Davy Crockett. Great battle scenes, nice sets, but way too long.
We're not talking about a movie.
We're talking about our holosuite program.
Oh, that Alamo. What about it?
We've got Holosuite Four reserved for an hour and we thought maybe you'd like to join us.
Look fellas, I'm touched by the offer, but I don't know...
We could transfer your matrix into the Alamo program.
You've got to get out of Vegas every once in a while, right?
True, but I'm afraid I've gotta say no.
Why?
I don't look good in buckskin.
I'll tell you what I'll do though...
How about a little tune to get you into a Texas state of mind.
What the hell -- ?
What's all this?
Don't ask me.
Maybe there's a pointer fault in the holosuite parameter's file...
Well look who's here...
The pretty boy singer himself.
Frankie Eyes... what are you doing in Vegas?
What happened to "Hello, Frankie, long time no see. Make yourself at home. Can I get you anything?" You believe this guy?
No manners.
Were you born in a barn or something?
(to Vic, re: Frankie) Is this gentleman a friend of yours?
We know each other.
We're a long way from South Philly, ain't we Vic?
You here on business or pleasure?
Let's just say I'm here to stay. While you, Vicky-boy, are about to take a powder.
I'm not going anywhere.
I got news for you, pal. I just bought this hotel. You're history.
You can't fire me. I have a contract.
And you can paper your walls with it. You're finished in this town, Vic.
You're blackballing me?
As of this moment, you couldn't get a job as a singing busboy. Now are you gonna walk out of here, or do you have to be carried out? Makes no difference to me.
Let me handle this. Computer. Delete characters Frankie Eyes and -- I'm sorry, I didn't catch your name.
Cicci.
And Cicci from this holosuite program.
What's a holosuite?
Beats me.
(to O'Brien, re: Frankie and Cicci) How come they're still here?
Beats me. There must be a little problem with the character deletion algorithm. Computer, freeze program.
Make that a big problem.
What's it going to be, "pallie?"
I guess I start packing.
Smart boy. Now let's go check out my casino.
What do we do now?
Nothing we can do. Frankie's a made man. Capice?
I'm not just talking about Frankie, I'm talking about fixing the entire program.
I suppose we could shut it down manually and reset it.
But that would mean wiping Vic's memory. He'd forget everything that's happened since we first activated him.
Hold on, pallie. No one's wiping my memory.
Of course not. There has to be another way.
I just wish I knew what it was.
Maybe I better talk to my friend, Felix. After all, he designed this program.
You do that.
In the meantime, you'd better stay clear of Frankie Eyes.
You'll get no argument from me.
I'll tell you one thing, if this Frankie Eyes hurts Vic in any way, he's going to have to answer to me.
I don't understand how you can feel such loyalty to a hologram.
He's not just a hologram, he's my friend.
Don't you like Vic?
As a singer, I find him... entertaining. But beyond that, I neither like him nor dislike him. He's a hologram. And therefore, does not exist.
He does to me.
I spoke to Felix. I know what's affecting Vic's program. It's a jack-in-the-box.
A what?
A jack-in-the-box. It's a children's toy, on Earth. You wind it up and a figure jumps out and goes "Boo!"
Except this type of jack-in-the- box is different.
It doesn't go "Boo?"
No, this surprise is buried deep in the holosuite program.
It's meant to shake things up, keep things interesting...
I wasn't bored. Were you?
Not a bit. I liked Vic's just the way it was.
According to Felix, if we get rid of Frankie Eyes, everything resets to the way it was.
That's good to know.
So how do we get rid of Frankie Eyes?
That's up to us. But Felix warned me that the program is period specific.
In other words, if we have to shoot him, we have to do it with a forty-five automatic and not a phaser.
We can't shoot Frankie, it's too dangerous.
The mob could retaliate against Vic.
And if anything happens to Vic, his matrix will be eliminated from the program. Permanently.
The news just keeps getting better, doesn't it?
What news?
Nothing, sir. We're discussing a holosuite program.
Vic Fontaine's hotel has been bought by gangsters.
I see. And when are you planning to get back to work?
Right away, sir.
Whatever you decide to do, Chief, count me in. I owe Vic. I thought losing my leg was the end of my Starfleet career. He taught me otherwise.
He changed my life, too. And Odo's.
Now all we need is a plan.
Your daddy would be proud.
He taught me everything I know. So how was your day?
(without much enthusiasm) It's getting better.
Something happen?
(trying to shrug it off) It's Vic.
Vic?
Vic Fontaine. A gangster named Frankie Eyes took over his lounge. The whole place has changed. And no one's sure how to change it back.
What?
Nothing.
I guess it sounds pretty silly to you.
A little.
You have to understand, Vic isn't just another holosuite program. He's more like a friend.
Kas -- can we talk about something else?
Sure. How come you've never been to Vic's?
Does it matter? You like going there. I don't. Let's leave it at that.
I was only asking...
And I gave you my answer.
There are times when I just can't figure you out.
(trying to keep things light) Isn't that part of the attraction?
(giving him a little back) Believe that if you want to.
Who is it?
scene: 16   INT. CORRIDOR OUTSIDE VIC'S SUITE - NIGHT

quote: Miles and Julian.
scene: 16   INT. CORRIDOR OUTSIDE VIC'S SUITE - NIGHT

quote: Just a minute.
scene: 16   INT. CORRIDOR OUTSIDE VIC'S SUITE - NIGHT

quote: You wouldn't happen to have an ice pack on you...
scene: 16   INT. CORRIDOR OUTSIDE VIC'S SUITE - NIGHT

quote: Hey, pallie -- whose side are you on?
Sorry. You have three bruised ribs and a sprained left wrist. The good news is your skull seems to be in one piece.
I feel better already. A jack-in-the-box... I can't believe Felix would do that to me.
Don't take it personally. He thought he was doing me a favor... you know, by not letting things get boring.
I thought that was my job.
And you're great at it. You know we luv ya.
You going to tell us what happened?
I slipped in the bathtub.
And knocked over all this furniture looking for a bandage.
Something like that. Frankie sent Tony Cicci to pay me a little visit. He wanted to remind me not to take too long packing.
What is it between you and Frankie?
It goes back to the old neighborhood, when we were kids. I used to beat him at stickball.
And?
And nothing... we've been rivals ever since.
That Felix... when he designs a holosuite program, he doesn't fool around.
(wincing from the pain) Tell me about it.
You need to get some rest. Maybe take a little vacation.
A vacation? Did you guys take a vacation when the Dominion took over D.S. Nine?
It's not the same thing...
It is to me. This is my life, remember? I don't run at the first sign of trouble.
No one's asking you to run. We're just asking you to stay out of sight for a few days while we come up with a plan.
What plan?
A way to get rid of Frankie Eyes.
Odo and Kira are down in the lounge right now.
Doing what?
Checking up on Frankie. We need to find his weak spot.
I hope you know what you're getting me into. If you guys screw up, I'm the one who winds up buried in the desert.
Let me guess, you're going to look around here while I check the casino.
If you'd prefer, I'll go and --
Enjoy yourself. But remember, we've got a job to do.
Of course.

... so I drive him out to the woods and badda-bing badda-bang, I put three in the back of his head and that's the end of little Paulie. And what do you think Frankie says to me when I report back in? "Little Paulie?" he says, "I told you to pop Big Paulie!"
That's the trouble with our business, too many guys named Paulie.
Hit me.
I'm done.
Not so fast.
What kind of card is that to give such a pretty lady. Hit her again.
Isn't that against the rules?
Don't worry about it. Double your bet.
Twenty-six? What's wrong with you?
Again.
You're starting to aggravate me.
Finally. Pay the lady.
If I were you, I'd quit while I was ahead.
The name's Frank Chalmers, but everyone calls me Frankie Eyes.
Why's that?
Because I don't miss a trick.
You sound very sure of yourself.
Doubt is for losers.
You're quite a philosopher.
I'm thinking of writing a book.
Have you got a title?
Maybe you can help me think one up.
My talents lie in other directions.
Good title. Mind if I use it?
I'd say you've already paid for it.
Then what do you say we hit the roulette table. See if I can't buy Chapter One.
Hey, Max -- get over here. You gotta see this.
Can you believe it? He did it again. Buddy I've been hanging out in bars for twenty years and I've never seen a stunt like that.
There's nothing to it, really.
You hear that? The guy's the eighth wonder of the world and he says there's nothing to it. So where you from again?
Bajor.
Bajor... that's in Jersey, right?
Right.
(to the bartender, re: Odo) Max, another round for my friend here.
... turns out that Frankie Eyes was sent to Vegas by a man named Carl Zeemo.
Looks like Frankie's moving up in the world.
You've heard of Mister Zeemo?

Been around forever. Likes to pretend he's a sweet old man, but he's meaner than a junkyard dog. (thinking it through) This is all starting to make sense... I knew Frankie didn't have the bread to buy a hotel.
But Zeemo does.

More than enough. This is going to be a pretty sweet deal for him. The casino's been pulling in about a million bucks a month. Cash. And out of that, Zeemo will expect to be sent a couple hundred grand.
(knowing the right term) That would be the "skim."
Right off the top. Tax free. Frankie's got nothing to worry about as long as he sends Mister Zeemo his cut.
According to Frankie, Mister Zeemo's coming out here in six days to pick up the first payment. He's never been to Vegas and he wants to look over his newest acquisition.
What would happen to Frankie if he didn't give Zeemo his "skim?"
Frankie's not that dumb.
Miles, are you thinking what I'm thinking?
That depends on what you're thinking.
We have to see to it that Mister Zeemo never sees a penny of that money.
(smiling, to the others) That's what I was thinking.
You're talking about robbing the casino...
