What's the matter, Nog? Afraid of looking weak in front of the Hew-mons?
I want to earn their respect, if that's what you mean.
At the price of your soul? Look at you... you hold that phaser rifle as if it were made of pure latinum.
We're in the middle of a war and this rifle can keep me alive. I'm a Starfleet officer...
You're a Ferengi... and I wish you'd start acting like one.
You mean hide under a rock every time trouble starts?
I'll tell you one thing, nephew... if the Federation had listened to the Ferengi Alliance there would never have been a war.
Because we would've surrendered a long time ago.
No -- because we would've reached an accommodation. We would've sat across the negotiation table and hammered out a peace treaty. One that both sides could've lived with...
You make it sound so simple.
Just remember Rule of Acquisition one-twenty-five, "You can't make a deal if you're dead."
Nog.
I'm sending you with Larkin and Reese out on a scouting patrol.
Yes, sir.
I need to know what we're up against... how many Jem'Hadar are out there, where they're camped, what kind of weapons they have with them.
When do we leave?
Right away.
Hold on a minute -- why Nog, when you have all these veterans to choose from?
No one asked your opinion.
Our tricorders aren't working...
... But my hearing is. You can count on me, sir. I'll find the Jem'Hadar.
Let's go.
Nog -- wait!
He has his orders, Quark.
That's so easy for you to say -- but I bet you wouldn't send Jake out there.
Jake isn't a Starfleet officer.
It doesn't matter. The point is you've managed to cut through the jamming signals.
scene: 54   INT. BASE CAMP - COMMUNICATIONS BUNKER - NIGHT

quote: That's enough to scan the entire compound. Now the question is how do we calibrate the tricorder so it can locate the mines in subspace.
scene: 54   INT. BASE CAMP - COMMUNICATIONS BUNKER - NIGHT

quote: Maybe we should try cross linking the optronic and isodyne relays.
scene: 54   INT. BASE CAMP - COMMUNICATIONS BUNKER - NIGHT

quote: You sure you're not an engineer?
scene: 54   INT. BASE CAMP - COMMUNICATIONS BUNKER - NIGHT

quote: In nine lives I've been a little of everything...
scene: 54   INT. BASE CAMP - COMMUNICATIONS BUNKER - NIGHT

quote: Doesn't that get confusing?
scene: 54   INT. BASE CAMP - COMMUNICATIONS BUNKER - NIGHT

quote: You have no idea... I'll give you an example, this is my first time on the front lines.
scene: 54   INT. BASE CAMP - COMMUNICATIONS BUNKER - NIGHT

quote: You're talking about Ezri now.
scene: 54   INT. BASE CAMP - COMMUNICATIONS BUNKER - NIGHT

quote: Right. But Torias, Curzon, Jadzia... they were in battle many times. I can remember what it felt like... the fear... the anger... the adrenaline surge...
scene: 54   INT. BASE CAMP - COMMUNICATIONS BUNKER - NIGHT

quote: Having someone else's memories of being in combat is one thing... living through it yourself is another.
scene: 54   INT. BASE CAMP - COMMUNICATIONS BUNKER - NIGHT

quote: I suppose I'm going to find out.
scene: 54   INT. BASE CAMP - COMMUNICATIONS BUNKER - NIGHT

quote: You'll do fine.
scene: 54   INT. BASE CAMP - COMMUNICATIONS BUNKER - NIGHT

quote: What is it? What's going on?
scene: 56   EXT. ANOTHER SECTION OF ROCKY TERRAIN - NIGHT

quote: Time to go.
scene: 56   EXT. ANOTHER SECTION OF ROCKY TERRAIN - NIGHT

quote: Right.
scene: 56   EXT. ANOTHER SECTION OF ROCKY TERRAIN - NIGHT

quote: Someone's coming.
Stretcher!
Nog! What happened?
Jem'Hadar patrol.
Larkin?
Dead. Ferengi found the encampment. It's three kilometers south of here.
How many troops?
Two columns.
Two columns? How're we going to hold off two columns?
We'll have to even out the odds...
Any ideas?
I'm working on it.
Captain --
Bashir doesn't want anyone in there.
How's Nog?
It's a little late for you to care about that, isn't it?
Quark --
He's going to lose his leg -- does that answer your question?
What happens now? You'll be able to replace the leg, won't you?
Once we get him to a hospital, he can be given a biosynthetic limb. Unfortunately, there may be complications...
What's that supposed to mean?

Nog suffered severe thermal damage to his femoral motor nerves. I'm not sure they'll be able to stimulate artificial muscle tissue. There's no way to know that until the operation is performed. I'd better get back inside...
We've got to get Nog to a hospital!
We will -- as soon as we can.
That's not good enough!
I'm sorry, Quark.
Sorry? If you really cared about Nog you never would've sent him out on that patrol.
Listen to me, Quark, because I'm only going to say this once... I care about Nog and every other soldier under my command. Understood? Every damn one of them.
Captain...
scene: 69   INT. BASE CAMP - MAKESHIFT INFIRMARY - NIGHT

quote: At ease, ensign.
scene: 69   INT. BASE CAMP - MAKESHIFT INFIRMARY - NIGHT

quote: I'm sorry, sir.
scene: 69   INT. BASE CAMP - MAKESHIFT INFIRMARY - NIGHT

quote: About what?
scene: 69   INT. BASE CAMP - MAKESHIFT INFIRMARY - NIGHT

quote: About Larkin... I led her right into a trap.
scene: 69   INT. BASE CAMP - MAKESHIFT INFIRMARY - NIGHT

quote: You found the Jem'Hadar camp.
scene: 69   INT. BASE CAMP - MAKESHIFT INFIRMARY - NIGHT

quote: I heard them coming, but... it was too late. There was all this phaser fire... and I went down...
scene: 69   INT. BASE CAMP - MAKESHIFT INFIRMARY - NIGHT

quote: Nog, listen to me... you followed orders, you did what you were trained to do. I'm proud of you.
scene: 69   INT. BASE CAMP - MAKESHIFT INFIRMARY - NIGHT

quote: Thank you, sir.
scene: 69   INT. BASE CAMP - MAKESHIFT INFIRMARY - NIGHT

quote: It doesn't hurt. You'd think it would, but it doesn't.
scene: 69   INT. BASE CAMP - MAKESHIFT INFIRMARY - NIGHT

quote: I'm glad.
scene: 69   INT. BASE CAMP - MAKESHIFT INFIRMARY - NIGHT

quote: I'm going to be fine.
scene: 69   INT. BASE CAMP - MAKESHIFT INFIRMARY - NIGHT

quote: Captain... the communications array... it's worth it, right?
scene: 69   INT. BASE CAMP - MAKESHIFT INFIRMARY - NIGHT

quote: I hope to God it is...
scene: 69   INT. BASE CAMP - MAKESHIFT INFIRMARY - NIGHT

quote: Benjamin... I'm sorry to interrupt. We're ready.
scene: 69   INT. BASE CAMP - MAKESHIFT INFIRMARY - NIGHT

quote: Now remember, nobody moves 'til I say so.
Now all we have to do is figure out a way to disarm them.
We're not going to disarm them... we're going to use them.
Use them?
This is their camp... this is ours. There are mountains to the east and west... which means that they have to come through this ravine to get to us.
scene: 76   INT. BASE CAMP - COMMAND BUNKER - NIGHT (OPTICAL)

quote: Moving them shouldn't be too difficult...
scene: 76   INT. BASE CAMP - COMMAND BUNKER - NIGHT (OPTICAL)

quote: I also want you to reprogram them so that they're triggered by movement.
scene: 76   INT. BASE CAMP - COMMAND BUNKER - NIGHT (OPTICAL)

quote: I think we can manage that...
scene: 76   INT. BASE CAMP - COMMAND BUNKER - NIGHT (OPTICAL)

quote: That should take out a third of their forces.
scene: 76   INT. BASE CAMP - COMMAND BUNKER - NIGHT (OPTICAL)

quote: What's the matter, old man? You don't think it'll work?
scene: 76   INT. BASE CAMP - COMMAND BUNKER - NIGHT (OPTICAL)

quote: It's not that. It's just that a few hours ago, we thought of those mines as the kind of ruthless weapon only the Dominion would use. But now...
scene: 76   INT. BASE CAMP - COMMAND BUNKER - NIGHT (OPTICAL)

quote: They've become a whole lot friendlier.
scene: 76   INT. BASE CAMP - COMMAND BUNKER - NIGHT (OPTICAL)

quote: Sooner or later, the Jem'Hadar are going to come through those barricades -- and when they do, the fewer there are, the better our chances of survival. You have your orders.
scene: 76   INT. BASE CAMP - COMMAND BUNKER - NIGHT (OPTICAL)

quote: Extra power packs.
You hear that?
I didn't hear anything.
Relax. When they get here, you'll know.
Sorry. My thumb got a little nervous.
I know how you feel.
I wonder if the Jem'Hadar get jittery before a battle.
I wouldn't count on it.
What the hell is that?
Sshh. Just listen.
Your idea?
I thought we could all use some Vic Fontaine right about now.
How's Nog?
There's not much more I can do for him until we get back to the station. I take it you were able to "move" the mines?
Put it this way, I wouldn't go for a stroll in that ravine tonight.
I wasn't planning to... ... of course, I wasn't planning on being here either.
I can see you've done that before.
Too many times. Funny thing is, I joined Starfleet to save lives...
Maybe they're not coming... maybe they're turning back... maybe we got them all.
Fire!
You alive? Captain...
-- you with us?
I think so.
We held.
Those were the orders
Captain --
scene: 123  INT. BASE CAMP - COMMUNICATIONS BUNKER - NIGHT

quote: Yes, Mister Worf...
scene: 123  INT. BASE CAMP - COMMUNICATIONS BUNKER - NIGHT

quote: The USS Veracruz has entered orbit. They're beaming down troop replacements and an engineering crew.
scene: 123  INT. BASE CAMP - COMMUNICATIONS BUNKER - NIGHT

quote: What about our people?
scene: 123  INT. BASE CAMP - COMMUNICATIONS BUNKER - NIGHT

quote: Doctor Bashir is aboard the Veracruz with Nog and the rest of the wounded. They'll be taken to the hospital at Starbase Three-Seven-One.
scene: 123  INT. BASE CAMP - COMMUNICATIONS BUNKER - NIGHT

quote: Good. I'll join you on the Defiant shortly.
scene: 123  INT. BASE CAMP - COMMUNICATIONS BUNKER - NIGHT

quote: It should be operational within a few days. This was a great victory. Worthy of story and song.
scene: 123  INT. BASE CAMP - COMMUNICATIONS BUNKER - NIGHT

quote: It cost enough.
scene: 123  INT. BASE CAMP - COMMUNICATIONS BUNKER - NIGHT

quote: Children.
Not for long. Ready?
Let's go.
Sisko to the Defiant... three to beam up.
Sir... the latest casualty reports have been posted.
How many this time?
Including the troops lost at AR- Five-Five-Eight... seventeen hundred and thirty.
Seventeen hundred and thirty.
That's a lot of names.
They're not just names... It's important we remember that. We have to remember...
It's Doctor Bashir, isn't it? Of course it is. May I introduce myself?
Uh... yes, yes of course.
My name is Garak; Cardassian by birth, obviously. The only one of us left on the station, as a matter of fact. So I do appreciate making new friends when I can. You are new to the station, I believe.
I am, yes...
Though... though I understand you've been here quite a while.
Ah, you know of me, then.
Would you care for some of this Tarkalean tea? It's very good.
What a thoughtful young man. How nice that we've met.
You know... there are some who say you've remained on DS Nine as the... eyes and ears of your fellow Cardassians...
You don't say. Doctor, you're not intimating that I'm considered some sort of... "spy," are you?
I wouldn't know, Sir.

Ah! An open mind. The essence of intellect. As you may also know, I have a clothing shop nearby, so... If you should require any apparel, or merely wish, as I do, for a bit of enjoyable company now and then, I'm at your disposal, Doctor.
You're very kind, Mister Garak.
Oh, it's just Garak. Plain, simple Garak. And now, good day to you, Doctor... I'm so glad to have made such an interesting new friend today.
(trying to suppress excitement) You'll never believe who just sat down next to me at the replimat...
Major, upper pylon three will be shut down for maintenance for forty- eight hours...
The spy!
Garak... the Cardassian...
We don't know for a fact that Garak's a spy, Doctor...
He's a spy... you should have heard him... introduced himself and struck up a conversation, just like that... he was making contact with me... with me of all people...
What do you think he might want from you, Julian?
I don't know. Federation medical secrets... ... rest assured they're safe with me, Commander.
I'm sure they are, Doctor Bashir...
In fact... Chief O'Brien, I think you should place a monitoring device on me...
Just in case... he is... up to something.
I don't think that'll be necessary, Doctor... just be very cautious when you're around...
Commander? We've got a small craft taking evasive action... Cardassian war vessel in pursuit.
On screen.
That's Bajoran! That damned Cardassian's firing at a Bajoran scout ship in Bajoran space!
Mister O'Brien?
Confirmed, Sir. They've crossed into Bajoran space.
Open a hailing frequency to the Cardassians...
Channel open...
Cardassian vessel: you are violating Bajoran space. Break off your pursuit. Repeat: Break off now.
No reply from the Cardassians. The Bajoran vessel is hailing us...
Open the channel...
... Space station... Do you read?... Space station...
We can only get audio, Commander.
This is Benjamin Sisko, Starfleet Commander of this station. Who are you? Why are they pursuing?
...Please!... Repeating request for emergency docking!... Please!
The Bajoran scout ship is badly damaged. Structural integrity is failing.
He's breaking up.
Get him out, Mister O'Brien.
Aye, Sir...
Medical assistance to Ops.
My name is Tahna... Request... political... asylum... (recognizes Kira; stunned) ...Kira?...
His name is Tahna Los. We fought together in the underground.
Commander, the Cardassians are hailing us.
Now they want to talk...
They're hopping mad.
Open the channel, Mister O'Brien.
Federation Commander, you've taken aboard a known criminal. You will turn him over to us.
scene: 9    INCLUDING MAIN VIEWSCREEN - INT. CARDASSIAN BRIDGE

quote: He has requested asylum.
scene: 9    INCLUDING MAIN VIEWSCREEN - INT. CARDASSIAN BRIDGE

quote: You have not granted it...
scene: 9    INCLUDING MAIN VIEWSCREEN - INT. CARDASSIAN BRIDGE

quote: To be honest, I haven't decided yet...
scene: 9    INCLUDING MAIN VIEWSCREEN - INT. CARDASSIAN BRIDGE

quote: He is Kohn-Ma! Even the Bajorans would not grant his kind asylum...
scene: 9    INCLUDING MAIN VIEWSCREEN - INT. CARDASSIAN BRIDGE

quote: He has committed heinous crimes against the Cardassian people... and I demand you release him to our custody... if you do not...
scene: 9    INCLUDING MAIN VIEWSCREEN - INT. CARDASSIAN BRIDGE

quote: I'll investigate the matter immediately. In the interim, if you'd care to dock your vessel, I'll be glad to hear your explanation for having violated Bajoran space and threatened a Federation facility.
scene: 9    INCLUDING MAIN VIEWSCREEN - INT. CARDASSIAN BRIDGE

quote: We have made no threat to your facility.
scene: 9    INCLUDING MAIN VIEWSCREEN - INT. CARDASSIAN BRIDGE

quote: I stand corrected. Sisko out.
scene: 9    INCLUDING MAIN VIEWSCREEN - INT. CARDASSIAN BRIDGE

quote: The Major and I will be in the Infirmary. I'd like some time to talk with this fellow Tahna. When Gul Danar comes in, it'd be nice if we had a few docking regulations that keep him outside a while.
scene: 9    INCLUDING MAIN VIEWSCREEN - INT. CARDASSIAN BRIDGE

quote: Understood.
scene: 9    INCLUDING MAIN VIEWSCREEN - INT. CARDASSIAN BRIDGE

quote: You're not seriously considering handing Tahna over to the Cardassians...
Were you part of this Kohn-Ma, Major?
If I had been, I wouldn't be working with the provisional government now...

No, you'd still be out murdering Cardassians... or even some Bajorans that the Kohn-Ma hold in contempt... didn't they claim responsibility for the assassination of one of your First Ministers last month... ?
Look, I know Tahna...
Is he Kohn-Ma?
Yes... but...

I suggest you get your priorities straight, Major... because I have no room for divided loyalties in this command. And I won't have a Kohn-Ma terrorist using this station as a protective shield for continuing violence.
My priorities are straight, Commander; let's not be confused here -- my loyalties are to Bajor. And Bajor needs men like Tahna Los.
His war with the Cardassians apparently isn't over...

If Bajor is ever going to rebuild a strong and independent society, it will require the repatriation of splinter groups like the Kohn-Ma... you have, we have, an opportunity here, Commander... I hope you don't miss it.
How is he?
Second degree burns, lacerations, a minor concussion... Not much compared to what he's been through before.
Before?
The most recent of these scars is only two, perhaps three years old.
Two-and-a-half, actually.
It's remarkable you lived through this.
It's a Cardassian technique designed to keep you alive.
I'm Commander Benjamin Sisko. I have a few questions for you... if you're up to answering them...
Commander Sisko hasn't decided whether to grant you asylum yet, Tahna.
Major, perhaps I should conduct this alone...
Major?
I'm the liaison officer to the Federation here. Still fighting for Bajor in my own way. I'll stop back later.
What do you need to know, Commander?
For starters, why were they chasing you?
You really want to hear the story of my life?
I assume as a member of the Kohn-Ma that you've committed serious acts against them...
Any one of a hundred that would lead to a Cardassian death sentence.
Any of them since their withdrawal from Bajor?
Frankly, yes.
Why would you continue the violence against them now?
To be honest, I'm not sure anymore, Commander...
We say we're punishing them for crimes committed against us for half a century... but... I've had enough of the killing.
I'm sorry, Commander. He needs rest now...
Admiral, I think Commander Sisko's being incredibly short-sighted. He obviously doesn't understand the issues involved...
Thank you for bringing this to my attention, Major. I'll stay in close touch with the situation...
Thank you, Admiral.
Sir, the Cardassian warship has docked. Lieutenant Dax is making sure that all procedural details are precisely observed no matter how long it takes.
Well done... I have some more research to do on the Kohn-Ma before I see them...
Sir... I don't know much about the Bajoran terrorists, but... You've never fought the Cardassians, have you?
No.
Well you just wouldn't want to turn a man... any man... over to their tender care, Sir. You just wouldn't.
Subspace transmission from Admiral Rollman for you, Commander...
In my office...
Ben, that Bajoran woman you've got working for you interrupted a staff meeting to tell me how she disapproves of your handling of this asylum matter... I think you have a problem there, Commander.
Yes, Admiral.
It's all right; you're safe.
Strange to run into each other here, isn't it?
It's good to be with someone who knows what it's been like out there.
Wearing that uniform, I thought maybe you'd forgotten.
Never.
Working on the inside hasn't dulled that old fire just a little?
Ask Sisko about that.
Don't get along?
Oil and water.
You're tired. I should go.
You think he'll give me to the Cardassians, Kira?
Over my dead body.
That's the Kira I remember...
If you require all vessels to endure such lengthy docking procedures, Commander, you're going to have a lot of impatient traffic out there.
I apologize... we're still trying to repair all the damage your forces did before they left... it does create unreasonable delays.
I accept your apology, not your explanation. What about Tahna Los?
Well, we've got a problem.
A diplomatic insult to the Cardassian people would be a problem... delivering a wanted criminal to us would not be...
(seeking a reasonable solution) Danar, in war, both sides commit atrocities...
My "request" for this man is made in connection with an extremely sensitive issue. I can only tell you that we are certain he plans to commit more acts of terrorism...
He tells me that he has renounced the Kohn-Ma... and wants to help to rebuild Bajor...
He committed brutal acts of destruction and murder and he must pay for those crimes...

I appreciate the Cardassian position... ... but I know if a Bajoran freedom- fighter is turned over to the Cardassians by the Federation... that would be a mistake that would undermine everything I'm trying to accomplish here. So, with apologies, I'm going to grant him asylum for the time being. Eventually, he'll want to relocate to Bajor and if you want to pursue the matter with the provisional government that's your business.
How long since you've slept in a comfortable bed?
I can adapt to that part very quickly, thank you.
I'm glad you're here. We need you, Tahna...
I don't think the Federation has any use for my particular talents...
I mean Bajor needs you. If you had the impression that I'm a Federation officer in any way, I promise you...
I thought you were under Sisko's command...
I am, but...
Now that's something I could never adapt to...
Somebody's got to coordinate relations between the Federation and the provisional government... at least if someone like me is here...
Why?
Why should they be here at all? What right does this so-called provisional government have to bring them here...
I know...
... after everything we fought for, Kira... freedom from domination... true independence... No outsiders. No Cardassians. No Federations.
Things have changed, Tahna. Now that the wormhole has been discovered...
Yes, the wormhole.
Look, I don't want the Federation here any more than you do... but they are serving a purpose. For the time being, at least.

Without the Federation, the Cardassians would be back in a minute to take control of the wormhole. And the wormhole is the future of Bajor, Tahna. It's bringing ships and commerce... it makes us a power in the quadrant...
I don't want to be a power in the quadrant. I want Bajor for Bajorans. I want our homeland back.

We have it back. And as we grow stronger, we'll be able to defend it ourselves... we won't have to lean on the Federation or anyone else. I know it's difficult to see... after all we've been through, we want it all now... but with people like you leading the way...
You have adapted, haven't you... ?
Tahna, I've put myself on the line for you here... you are finished with the Kohn-Ma...
Yes, I'm finished with the Kohn-Ma.
I've been talking with several of the ministers in the provisional government about amnesty. For you and for any member of the Kohn-Ma who follows you.
There are some who might. If there were assurances...
I'm working on it, Tahna. I'll find a way to make it happen.
What.
scene: 21   INT. PROMENADE - AIR LOCK AREA - ON N/D SECURITY

quote: Sir, these two... ...women... are just arriving. They...
scene: 21   INT. PROMENADE - AIR LOCK AREA - ON N/D SECURITY

quote: (indicates semi- conscious Guard) ... objected to giving up their weapons.
scene: 21   INT. PROMENADE - AIR LOCK AREA - ON N/D SECURITY

quote: Klingons do not surrender their weapons. We are Lursa and B'Etor. Of the house of Duras.
scene: 21   INT. PROMENADE - AIR LOCK AREA - ON N/D SECURITY

quote: And we have specific regulations. You can leave the weapons or leave the station. Your choice; please make it now.
scene: 21   INT. PROMENADE - AIR LOCK AREA - ON N/D SECURITY

quote: Who are you?
scene: 21   INT. PROMENADE - AIR LOCK AREA - ON N/D SECURITY

quote: I'm the one giving you the choice.
scene: 21   INT. PROMENADE - AIR LOCK AREA - ON N/D SECURITY

quote: Welcome to DS Nine.
scene: 21   INT. PROMENADE - AIR LOCK AREA - ON N/D SECURITY

quote: Come in.
We have some new guests you might be interested in... Couple of Klingon sisters from the Duras Family...
Lursa and B'Etor...
You know them, then.
They tried to grab control of the Klingon High Council... started a brief civil war. They've been out of sight since then...
I ran a security check... the Klingons have them listed as renegades...
We've heard they're trying to raise capitol to rebuild their armies... So, what are they doing here?
Sitting. They went straight to Quark's. But not for the gambling... and certainly not for the food. They're just... sitting.
I don't like it...
Why don't I lock them up and call the Klingons to come get them...
Odo...
If they're enemies of the Klingon High Council...
They haven't broken any laws here. You can't just throw them in jail.
You know, Cardassian rule may've been oppressive, but at least it was simple.
Keep an eye on them.
As you wish, Commander.
And how are you this evening, Mister Garak? Oh, excuse me... It's just plain, simple Garak, you said.
Plain and simple. Join me, Doctor; enhance my evening.
Keeping an eye on the ebb and flow of things, are you?
As a clothier, I do interest myself in what the population is wearing from day to day.
You... must have to stay abreast of the latest trends, don't you?
Hmmm.
Of course, I know very little about the latest trends in medicine, comparatively speaking.
Medicine? I was talking about clothes.
Yes, of course. Clothes. Medicine. Trends. You know.
Klingons have an odd sense of... style, don't you think?
But intriguing... I say those two... outfits... are worth studying closely... one never knows where the next trend may come from...
The payment.
It's on its way.
That was not the arrangement.
I couldn't stop to get it. I barely got past the Cardassians.
Your safety is not our concern.
Your gold is.
It will be available tomorrow.
Good.
... Because if we've made this trip for nothing, you'll have made a fatal mistake.
I've managed to arrange a hearing of the Ministers' Court...
And predictions?
I have two of the ministers, the smart ones, ready to vote for amnesty... I'm sure one of the others will fall in line...
Good...
And Tahna says two more members of the Kohn-Ma have agreed to come in... as long as you'll guarantee their safety...
Done.
I have to say this, Commander... when we first talked I wasn't sure you... ... this wouldn't have been possible without your support. I want you to know it's appreciated.
(acknowledges, pleasantly conversational) Be sure to mention it the next time you chat with Admiral Rollman...
Sir...
Go over my head again and I'll have yours on a platter...
News about our Klingon sisters?
They seem to make friends easily.
Friends... ?
Our reformed Kohn-Ma, for example...
Tahna... with Lursa and B'Etor?
Talking about a business arrangement. He's paying them for something. I don't know what. The gold is supposedly on its way...
Two other members of the Kohn-Ma may be bringing it...
How do you know that?
Major Kira mentioned that they're on their way...
You want her to know about this?
Not quite yet.
You are the clothier, Garak... ?
At your service, madame. May I show you our latest fashions... perhaps some silk lingeries from Kraus-Four?
Watch your tongue, Cardassian. Or I'll cut it off and eat it.
I meant no offense. I have few Klingon patrons. What is it you wish to buy...
We are not here to buy... but to sell...
We understand you still... represent Cardassian interests here.
I am only a simple clothing merchant...
We have no time for your games... do you want Tahna Los or not...
You are in a position to deliver the Bajoran to Cardassian authorities?
What is he worth to them?
In gold-press latinum.
You insult us.
Ladies, ladies... please... everything is negotiable...
I am only what I seem to be - a merchant seeking to make the best transaction... Let us... haggle.
Yes, come in.
I have the third minister's vote... the hearing is simply a formality now... you're going to receive amnesty, Tahna...
I never realized you were such an accomplished politician, Kira...
Me? A politician? I don't think so...
You manipulate Sisko and the Federation... the ministers of the provisional government...
I'm just... determined... I think they all simply get tired of hearing my voice...
And we expected to find that Kira Nerys had lost the fire in her heart...
What are you talking about?
You knew I was here before you even came... Tahna, I've trusted you...
I am Kohn-Ma. I fight for the freedom of Bajor. You once fought for it as well.
I am still fighting for it...
Kira, stop deluding yourself... you say you don't believe in the provisional government... you say you don't believe in the Federation... and yet you are their... dance instructor.
That's not fair.
Don't be naive, Major.
I've told you I don't want the Federation here, but for now...
Once you're in your comfortable bed with the Federation, you won't be
If you expect me to help you commit some act of violence against the Federation...
No. The violence is over. That's the truth. No one will be hurt. In any way. I promise you that. But I do need your help...
You've already lied to me, Tahna; I know how the game works.
To do what we plan, we need a small ship capable of warp speed. I gambled that I could convince you to get it for us.
Just what is this "peaceful" plan?
In one move... and non-violently... we accomplish everything that both of us ever wanted for Bajor.
How?
I know the game, too. You know I can't risk telling you that.
How do you know I won't go straight to Sisko?
If you do, we'll both know where your loyalties are, won't we.

But I don't think you will. You want freedom for Bajor. In your heart, you know the Federation cannot give it to us. No one can give us freedom. We have to take it. You'll have to make the choice, Kira. Be with us. Or stop lying to yourself about what you've become.
Ah. Plain, simple Garak. How are you, today?
Being observant, Doctor.
I'm sure of it.
There's a time for levity, my young friend... and a time for genuine concern.
... The arrival on this station, for instance... ... of those two Kohn-Ma terrorists.
... of those two Kohn-Ma terrorists.
Terrorists... What are they doing here... ?
I'm not exactly sure; but together, we might have some success at finding out...
(in over his head, now) Together. Garak, I'm a doctor, not a...
Once you do have the appropriate answer, I'm sure you'll know what to do with it.
I really must be getting along...
Doctor, I think it's time for you to take advantage of my shop. If you'll be there at exactly twenty fifty- five hours this evening, I promise to show you a suit that will make you into a new man.
A suit? We're talking about terrorists, and you want me to buy a new suit?
Doctor, am I making myself clear? I want you to buy a new suit tonight at twenty-fifty-five. Exactly.
I see. Yes... If you'll excuse me now...
Major... ?
Yes, Commander.
I'd like to meet the two Kohn-Ma who just arrived as soon as possible...
Of course. I'll arrange it.
How do they seem to you?
Sir?
Do you feel as secure about them as you do about Tahna Los?
Absolutely.
Commander Sisko...
... I need some guidance...
Yes, Doctor... ?
It's about... Garak, the Cardassian... I'm afraid this... relationship... has gotten a little out of hand.
How's that?
He wants me to buy a suit.
A suit.
At exactly twenty-fifty-five tonight.
Why twenty-fifty-five?
I don't know... but it has something to do with the Bajoran terrorists on board.
He... he says that together, he and I might discover what they're really doing here. (Sisko reacts, muses, a beat) I don't understand why he wants me involved...
Sometimes, communications can't be conducted through official channels. Maybe this is their way of telling us that we have a common enemy.
What do you want me to do?
I think, Doctor, that you could definitely use a new suit.
Busy?
What can I do for you?
Are all the security measures in place for the trip to the Ministers' Court... ?
I told you they'd be taken care of and they will.
Fine.
You know, there's one thing about you humanoids I can't imitate very well...
What's that?
Pretense. There's a special talent to it. It's as hard for me as creating one of your noses.
Maybe, that's why I've learned to respect your opinion, Constable. Never any... pretense. How much do you know about me, Odo?
More than you probably realize.
I've done some things I'm not proud of. I still have nightmares about the raids on the Haru outposts. But at least I was sure of what I was doing then.
And there's something you're not sure of now.
You have no more love for the Federation than I do.
Meaning?
Maybe there are still wars to be fought and I'm just making a fool of myself doing what I'm doing here.
Sounds like you're trying to talk yourself into something. Or out of something.
Either way, I have to betray someone.
Only important thing is not to betray yourself. he looks at him... a beat... they both know what they're talking about here.
How could I possibly turn against my own people?
Are they? Your own people?
They're no different than I used to be.
Used to be.
I could just refuse to help them. Ignore the whole thing.
The Joranian ostrich hides by sticking its head under water. Sometimes even until it drowns.
They'd find a way to do whatever they want to do anyway... and I'd still feel responsible for the consequences.
It was so much easier when I knew who the enemy was.
Go ahead.
There's someone down here in security who wants to talk to you, Commander.
Doctor, it's Twenty-fifty-seven. You're late. Come in quickly, please.
scene: 55   INT. GARAK'S SHOP - FAVORING CLOSED ENTRANCE

quote: I... I was...
scene: 55   INT. GARAK'S SHOP - FAVORING CLOSED ENTRANCE

quote: You just try that on as many times as you like, and be very, very quiet.
scene: 55   INT. GARAK'S SHOP - FAVORING CLOSED ENTRANCE

quote: Ah, right on time. Welcome.
Ah, right on time. Welcome.
Save your "welcomes," Cardassian. Do your people want the Bajoran or not?
I can now venture to say, with some certainty, that you will receive the agreed-upon payment on delivery.
We will complete our business with Tahna Los in four hours...
And what business might that be?
That is not your concern.
If it requires that those I represent must take extra precautions, it becomes my concern.
We are delivering a cylinder of Bilitrium to him.
The rendezvous will be on the dark side of Bajor Eight's lower moon.
The Cardassians can have him then.
What's Bilitrium?

A rare crystalline element, that can be an incredibly powerful source of energy... Provided, of course, that one also has an anti-matter converter. Unfortunately, that's why Cardassians were chasing Tahna Los when he arrived here. He stole one.
But if he's got both...
Quite right, Doctor. He will have the ingredients for a bomb. A bomb of significant destructive capability.
We have nothing to hold them on.... they haven't committed any crime yet...
Conspiracy is a crime...
But conspiracy to what? We don't even know what their plan is...
Once the exchange is made, with the Klingons, you've got them holding the components to an explosive device... that's enough evidence right there...
Chief O'Brien's right. We have to let them have a runabout.
Agreed.
And I have to be on it.
Not agreed. Major...

Commander, Tahna doesn't know if he can trust me as it is... if I try to stay behind, he won't buy into this. The only way to convince him is if I'm on board. If Tahna fails, I promise you others will try. At least, this way you can find out what they're up to.
Mister O'Brien, you and I will take a Runabout to a point behind the second moon of Bajor Eight to avoid detection.
Aye, Sir...
Dax, stay in touch with us on a secured channel... keep an eye on the Cardassians; they'll be coming to the party too...
You get him there, Major... we'll be waiting...
This'll be the first time a Bajoran officer's taken out a Federation Runabout alone...
It might get Sisko's attention. We'd better initialize pre-launch the minute we get on board...
They're moving into the Runabout...
Acknowledged. DS Nine to Ganges.
Go ahead, Dax.
Major Kira and Tahna are preparing to leave in the Yangtzee Kiang.
They're initializing pre-launch systems now...
Understood, Lieutenant. ... Shut down all main power systems.
Main power systems down. ... Dead quiet...
Bajor Eight in one-hundred-twenty thousand kilometers. Dropping to impulse. What is that?
An anti-matter converter... I'm transferring power from the ship's warp drive into the storage cells.
We've got a Klingon Bird of Prey decloaking dead ahead.
Calm down... we're here to meet them...
Klingons, why?
You'll know soon enough.
The Klingons have powered up their transporters...
Prepare to go to full impulse.
Thirteen kilograms of gold-press Latinum; as promised.
This is yours.
'eH. HImaH!
What is it?
Bajoran independence.
Bird of Prey is moving off... and cloaking.
Set an intercept course with the Runabout.
Intercept in one minute, twelve seconds.
DS Nine to Ganges...
Ganges...
The Cardassian warship Aldara is crossing the border, Benjamin... on an intercept course with the Yangtzee Kiang.
They'll enter Bajoran space in twenty- nine seconds...
Acknowledged.
The Yangtzee's sensors should be picking us up now, sir...
They must've been waiting for us here. How did they know?
We've also got a Cardassian warship three minutes away...
The Klingons must have sold us out...
Prepare to engage warp engines.
There's nowhere to run, Tahna...
We don't have to go far.
I should have know... (grabs her, pushes her to her chair) Set the course for DS Nine.
No.
If you don't, I'll explode the bomb right here and destroy all six colonies on Bajor Eight.
You would kill thousands of your own people for this?
The question is whether you would kill them by refusing to set the course...
They've gone to warp...
Follow them.
Ganges to Yangtzee Kiang. Drop out of warp, or we will open fire...
Repeat. We will open fire.
I doubt that he'll shoot with his Major on board. But just in case...
This is the voice of the Kohn-Ma... there is an armed bilitrium explosive device on board this ship...
Fire on us and you will detonate it.
If that device goes off while they're at warp, they'll spread radiation across half the system.
He's headed straight back for the station.
So we're finally allies, Commander.
Gul Danar, the Federation Runabout Yangtzee Kiang is carrying an explosive bilitrium device. Can you intercept before it reaches the space station?
We believe they intend to set it off at the mouth of the wormhole... will you be able to ready them before they get here?
Our time to intercept is two minutes, fourteen seconds...
That's about a minute too late, Commander...
If I may, Commander, take this opportunity to say that I warned you...
Ready photons, Chief. We'll fire as soon as they slow to impulse... at least that'll diminish the spread of bilitrium radiation throughout the area...
Aye, sir.
One hundred thousand kilometers to the wormhole...
Slow to impulse... take us within fifty meters of the mouth...
You're only hurting Bajor by doing this, Tahna...
No one's going to be hurt, Kira. Adjust your course to take a vectored approach past the mouth of the wormhole.
... The wormhole... it's not the space station you're after... you can't possibly believe you can destroy the wormhole with that device...
I don't have to destroy the wormhole... I just have to collapse the entrance
You're only hurting Bajor by doing this, Tahna...

Now!

The wormhole opens again... as Runabout Ganges arrives into this quadrant.

I'll have the clothier Garak make me a new one by tonight...
I'm not sure it's appropriate to have a Cardassian tailor make your Starfleet uniform, Julian... maybe the replicator...
I am Falow, Master Surchid of the Wadi.
Welcome in the name of Bajor and the United Federation of Planets. I am Commander Benjamin Sisko. On behalf of the senior members of my staff... ... Major Kira, Lieutenant Dax and Doctor Bashir...
Yes... yes... now where are the games?

Right this way.

Do they have money?
