quote: Drive it away!
scene: 35   EXT. VILLAGE SQUARE - THE PLATFORM - NIGHT

quote: Drive it away!
scene: 35   EXT. VILLAGE SQUARE - THE PLATFORM - NIGHT

quote: The Dal'Rok is defeated.
scene: 35   EXT. VILLAGE SQUARE - THE PLATFORM - NIGHT

quote: The village is safe.
scene: 35   EXT. VILLAGE SQUARE - THE PLATFORM - NIGHT

quote: The village is safe. All thanks to the prophets. The Sirah. The Sirah.
scene: 35   EXT. VILLAGE SQUARE - THE PLATFORM - NIGHT

quote: He's dead.
scene: 35   EXT. VILLAGE SQUARE - THE PLATFORM - NIGHT

quote: The Sirah has left us.
scene: 35   EXT. VILLAGE SQUARE - THE PLATFORM - NIGHT

quote: But the prophets have sent us his successor.
scene: 35   EXT. VILLAGE SQUARE - THE PLATFORM - NIGHT

quote: A new Sirah to tell the story.
scene: 35   EXT. VILLAGE SQUARE - THE PLATFORM - NIGHT

quote: A new Sirah... the story... All thanks to the prophets.
scene: 35   EXT. VILLAGE SQUARE - THE PLATFORM - NIGHT

quote: A new Sirah to protect the village.
scene: 35   EXT. VILLAGE SQUARE - THE PLATFORM - NIGHT

quote: Major, what a pleasant surprise. I always look forward to one of your infrequent visits.
Spare me the small talk and get me a star drifter.
So, how are the negotiations coming along?
Better make it a double.
Come in.
You asked to see me.
Please, sit down.
I just spent the last five hours sitting at a conference table.
Yes, five long, unproductive hours.
Woban is an obstinate fool.
Woban is here to talk. What are you here for?
I would think that was obvious. To defend the interests of my people.
How? By starting a war?
I object to your tone, Commander.
Because if that's what you want, if you'd rather fight than talk, then we're just wasting our time.
That land belongs to the Paqu.
The Navot don't agree.
Then they'd better be ready to die for it. I am. Or don't you believe me?
I believe in people working together to find reasonable solutions to their problems. I hope you do as well.
What you "hope" is no concern of mine. Now, anything else you wish to say to me can be said tomorrow across the conference table.
Varis...
Are you sure your people are as ready as you are to die for that land?
Where do you think she is?
I guess if she's not here, we can try again at her quarters.
When we find her, I want you to let me do the talking.
She asks me questions... I answer them. What's wrong with that?
Just remember, I saw her first. She's mine.
Then, how come you can barely say two words to her without getting tongue-tied?
That's a lie.
I've never seen you so nervous. You must really like her.
I never said that.
Uh... we were... uh... just...
Looking for you.
I've been... busy.
(picking up on her mood) Is something wrong? You seem a little depressed.
It's nothing, really. It's just... there are these people... who want something I have... and I refuse to give it to them.
How badly do they want it?
Very badly.
Is there anything they have that you want?
That I want?
Maybe this isn't a problem. Maybe it's an opportunity.
Maybe...
When I have a problem I can't figure out, I ask my dad.
(determined not to be outdone by Jake) I ask my dad, too.
It helps, doesn't it?
My dad's a pretty smart guy.
Mine, too. In his own way.
My parents are dead. They were killed by the Cardassians.
I'm sorry. My mom was killed during an attack by the Borg.
Isn't there someone you can talk to? Someone you trust?
I don't trust many people.
My dad says...
Could we please talk about something besides your father?
You admire him very much, don't you?
I trust him.
Mister Sisko...
Odo...
We were just leaving.
I wonder what was controlling those energy creatures.
One thing's certain, it wasn't me.
Try telling that to the villagers. They saw the Sirah choose you as his successor.
He made a mistake.

But you saw how he greeted you when we arrived. It was as if he were expecting you. I'll tell you, Chief, I'm glad you came along on this mission. If it wasn't for you, I'd have just done what I could for the Sirah and left. Look at what I'd have missed.
I'm glad you're enjoying yourself... Julian.
Don't worry, Chief, I have faith in you.
Do you?
For all we know, you really were sent by the prophets.

I was sent by Commander Sisko. That Dal'Rok... or whatever... will be returning tonight... and everyone's counting on me to stop it... Only trouble is I don't have the slightest idea how I'm supposed to do that.
These gifts are for you, Sirah.
Well tell them I don't want...
Bring them right in. Put them wherever you like.
Now look... Julian...
We're visitors here, Chief. It wouldn't be polite to refuse our hosts.
How can I help you ladies?
I think they're the ones offering services, Chief.
Now look here, there's been a serious misunderstanding...
Is there a problem, Sirah?
No, they're not... well, yes... they're quite... Look, I have a wife and daughter back at DS Nine.
Of course.
You must send for them.
Why?
So they can live here with you.
You're missing the point. You see, I'm not staying.
Then who will tell the story?
You'll just have to find someone else.
But there is no one else. The Sirah chose you.
He made a mistake.
But what about the Dal'Rok? Without your protection, he'll kill us all.
Look, Faren, I'd like to help, really I would, but I don't know how.
You must tell the story.
(sees there's no point in arguing) As simple as that, is it?
May the prophets grant you victory, Sirah.
Let's hope so.
Now what do we do?
The way I see it, there's only one way out of this mess. We have to find out exactly what this Dal'Rok is, and destroy it... before it destroys us.
Station Log supplemental. We have completed a second day of talks between the Paqu and the Navot. So far, we're no closer to finding a solution than we were when negotiations began.
Enter.
Hi, you want to do something?
I'm sorry. Not right now.
Okay, we'll stop by later.
Is there anything we can do to cheer you up?
(appreciates the concern) I don't think so.
You're sure?
Let's go, before you embarrass yourself.
Wait.
Yes?
You remember that... opportunity we were discussing yesterday?
Yes.
How can you be sure that an opportunity is worth the risk?
Instinct. The Ninth Rule of Acquisition clearly states "opportunity plus instinct equals profit."
Instinct.
That's not gonna help.
I think it does. Thank you, Nog.
Good. Let's celebrate.
Celebrate... ?
I took one of my uncle's security rods.
What are we gonna do with that?
I don't know... We could swipe Odo's bucket.
Are you kidding?
A bucket?
We'll give it back.
Yeah, but...
It'll be funny.
But we can't just walk into security...
Watch me.
I still don't understand what's so funny about a bucket.
Odo lives in it.
He's a shape-shifter. Every sixteen hours he has to change back to his original form.
Inside a bucket?
He turns into some kind of liquid.
Maybe this isn't such a good idea.
Watch the front door. I'll be right back.
Jake, you're sure this is all right?
(trying to convince himself) Well... it's not like we're really stealing anything.
Found it.
Odo!
It's oatmeal. I filled it from the replicator.
Very funny.
You should have seen your face!
I believe that belongs to me.
What's the rush?
There's some residual neutrino levels in the microstructure of the building material.
But if the Dal'Rok has no physical substance, how can it leave a neutrino trace?
I didn't say it made sense. But this wall didn't just spontaneously blow itself to pieces.
Lucky for us, you were able to stop it before it did anymore damage.
All I did was repeat what the Sirah told me.
All right, then how did the Sirah stop it?
Good question. Maybe there's some kind of controlling mechanism hidden somewhere.
Excuse me, miss...
Please Sirah, for the baby...
What about her?
I think she wants you to bless the child.
Me?
It would mean so much.
I'm sure she'll make you very proud.
Thank you.
You're quite welcome.
Looks like some more of your followers are requesting an audience
This won't do. You continue looking around here. I'll check the Sirah's room.
I'm afraid the Sirah is busy at the moment. Perhaps I can be of service.
(no time for interruptions) Look, I could use a little privacy.
There are more gifts outside.
All right, bring them in...
Hold on. You worked for the Sirah, didn't you?
I was his apprentice.
Did he ever reveal any of his secrets? How he controlled the Dal'Rok, that sort of thing?
Why ask me? Surely the Sirah taught you all you need to know.
All right, have it your way. But don't blame me when that creature goes rampaging through your village.
Chief!
Careful, don't hurt him.
I'll try not to.
That's enough.
Tell him that.
I said that's enough. Now you mind explaining why you tried to kill me?
You are not the true Sirah.
You won't get any argument from me.
If he's not, who is?
I am.
For five years, I studied with the Sirah, learning the secrets of the storyteller. Only to have you come along and take my place.
Look friend, as far as I'm concerned, the job's yours.
But if you were supposed to take over, why did the Sirah pick him?
It was his way of punishing me.
Punishing you?
Three nights ago, the Sirah allowed me to tell the story. But when the Dal'Rok appeared, I was unable to control it. Several people were injured.
Control it? How?
With this.
The stone is said to be a fragment of an orb from the celestial temple.
We had one of the orbs aboard our station. We're aware of how powerful they are.

Many years ago, this village was deeply divided by hate and mistrust. The first Sirah knew that unless he could find a way to unite the people, the village would destroy itself. So he used the orb fragment as a catalyst to give their fears a physical form.
So the villagers' thoughts create the Dal'Rok.
But they don't know that. It's a secret passed from Sirah to Sirah.
Why do they need a storyteller?
The story helps focus the villagers' thoughts...
(putting it all together) And enables them to defeat the Dal'Rok by creating the shimmering lights.
I know if I had another chance, I could control the Dal'Rok.
Well son, it looks like tonight you're going to get that chance.
What is this?
You have no right to wear those clothes.
I have every right...
You had your chance to prove yourself... you failed.
It won't happen again.
That's right... because you won't be allowed to endanger the village a second time. Now take off those robes.
Hold on...
Sirah, it's time you were getting ready. The people have assembled to hear the story.
I want you to know Commander, that I take complete responsibility for what happened in the security office.
I think there's more than enough blame to spread around. Jake should have known better.
I'm afraid he and Nog were just trying to impress me.
That's not much of an excuse.
Didn't you ever do anything foolish to impress a girl?
I may have.
Jake's a nice boy. So's Nog, in his own way. I enjoy their company.
I suppose you don't get much of a chance to be with people your own age.
True. But that's not why I wanted to be with them. I wanted to learn about you.
And... ?
Jake think's very highly of you. He... trusts you.
That's always nice to hear.
Hearing Jake speak of you reminded me how much I miss my own parents. My father was a great man. A great leader.
I'm sure he'd be very proud of you.
I try to be strong... the way he was strong... but it's... difficult.
From what I've learned about your father, he wasn't afraid to compromise.
That's because he knew the Navot feared him. If I were to make concessions, Woban would think I was weak.
I doubt he would be that foolish. But he is determined to get back that land.
I'm not afraid of Woban or the Navot.
I never said you were. So your answer is still no.
You don't lose by saying no.
Maybe. But a great leader... like your father... is one who's willing to risk saying yes.
Commander, I believe I know of an... opportunity... that could allow both sides to say yes.
(out of the side of his mouth) I thought you wanted this job.
I do.
Then why don't you fight for it.
No, Faren is right. The people will never accept me as Sirah and without their support, I could never control the Dal'Rok.
And you think I can?
You have to.
Good luck.
Speak... The story... Speak... Tell the story.
Once upon a time, there was a Dal'Rok. He lived there... In the woods... and he hated the village... and all of the villagers... and wanted to see them destroyed.
The Dal'Rok... it's here... the Dal'Rok.
Yes... the Dal'Rok has arrived... and it's... it's...
...hungry. But... the village is prepared to fight.
Something's wrong.
What's wrong is O'Brien's not the Sirah. You are.
The village is strong... and powerful... and unafraid... to face the Dal'Rok.
Did you ever think maybe the Sirah planned all this?

He knew the villagers had lost confidence in you, so he chose O'Brien as his successor, knowing you'd have to rescue him. Don't you see? This is your chance to prove once and for all that you're the true Sirah.
All right, let's really focus on this one and send the Dal'Rok a message... Okay, let's send that message... Where the hell are those lights?
Wait, there's no need to run. A new voice appears to challenge the Dal'Rok.
It's about time.

The Dal'Rok is a fearsome enemy. The mountains shake with its fury. But our prosperity is its misery. Our unity is its vulnerability. Our strength is its doom. Look... the Dal'Rok trembles. It fears our strength. It fears our determination. It knows it cannot stand against us.
There... see for yourselves, the Dal'Rok is defeated. The village is safe for another year.
The Sirah... Sirah.
Let's get out of here before they change their minds.
Nervous?
Not at all. Maybe a little. Do you think Woban will accept my proposal?
It's very possible. It does give the Navot back their land.
And free trade access to both sides of the river would mean a lot to my people.
It's a reasonable compromise.
We thought we'd wish you good luck with your meeting.
Thank you.
For all your help.
All right, let's go. You two are going to clean the Security office until it shines.
You know Chief, this is going to make a fantastic story to tell around the station.
No thanks. I've had my fill of storytelling for the time being.
Well, I hope you won't mind if I mention it.
Suit yourself... Julian.
Oh, and Chief, on second thought, you don't really have to call me Julian.
Right you are... Sir.
I didn't kill him, you know.
A lot of people believed it was me. That shape-shifter thought so. But he was wrong.
It was a long time ago.
(nods, beat, not ready to get down to business) Say what you will about the Cardassians... at least they could keep the power on... do you want more ice?
I'm fine.
You were always very kind.
Was I?
You made life a little easier.
I ran a black market for anyone who could pay. Never exactly thought of myself as... kind.
But there was a little extra ginger tea in the package you gave me, wasn't there...
You didn't call me to Bajor to talk about tea.
I need a favor.
For old times sake.
That's right.
I'm still as kind as ever.
I can pay you.
I'm listening.
My husband kept a strongbox in our shop on the station. Buried in the wall. I want you to bring it to me.
What's in it...
Nothing anyone would value.
Anyone but you.
Sentimental reasons.
Why not take a sentimental journey back to the station... if it's your property...
I couldn't stand going back to that shop... where my husband was murdered...
Or maybe you'd rather not let Odo see you there.
I'm sure he's forgotten about all that by now.
Can you neutralize the security system... ?
I knew I could count on you. It's behind the panelled wall to the right as you enter. Four panels in... and two up...
Four in. Two up.
I'll give you five bars of latinum.
Five... ?
And as always... my personal gratitude.
A day. Maybe two.
Commence Station Security log. Stardate 47282.5. At the request of Commander Sisko, I will hereafter be recording a daily log of law enforcement affairs.

The reason for this exercise is beyond my comprehension except perhaps that humans have a compulsion to keep records and lists and files... so many in fact that they have to invent new ways to store them microscopically. Otherwise their records would overrun all known civilization. My own very adequate memory not being good enough for Starfleet, I am pleased to put my voice to this official record of this day: Everything's under control. End log.
Now.
scene: 6    INT. PROMENADE - POV OF THE SECURITY OFFICE

quote: When we get to the entrance, you stay flat against the wall. It's a pulsatel lockseal. I can get it to release in about twenty-five seconds.
scene: 6    INT. PROMENADE - POV OF THE SECURITY OFFICE

quote: Twenty-five seconds... but somebody will see us... let me do it...
scene: 6    INT. PROMENADE - POV OF THE SECURITY OFFICE

quote: You? We'd be at it all night.
scene: 6    INT. PROMENADE - POV OF THE SECURITY OFFICE

quote: No, only about ten seconds.
scene: 6    INT. PROMENADE - POV OF THE SECURITY OFFICE

quote: How would you release a pulsatel lockseal in ten seconds?
scene: 6    INT. PROMENADE - POV OF THE SECURITY OFFICE

quote: You have one on the storeroom door.
scene: 6    INT. PROMENADE - POV OF THE SECURITY OFFICE

quote: So?
scene: 6    INT. PROMENADE - POV OF THE SECURITY OFFICE

quote: Sometimes when you forget to leave me the desealer, I have to get the storeroom open.
scene: 6    INT. PROMENADE - POV OF THE SECURITY OFFICE

quote: You've unsealed the storeroom without my knowledge?
scene: 6    INT. PROMENADE - POV OF THE SECURITY OFFICE

quote: Only to serve a customer's needs...
scene: 6    INT. PROMENADE - POV OF THE SECURITY OFFICE

quote: In ten seconds?
scene: 6    INT. PROMENADE - POV OF THE SECURITY OFFICE

quote: You forget fairly often.
scene: 6    INT. PROMENADE - POV OF THE SECURITY OFFICE

quote: Ten seconds. We'll see how you handle this desealing rod.
scene: 6    INT. PROMENADE - POV OF THE SECURITY OFFICE

quote: That's all right; I have my own.
scene: 6    INT. PROMENADE - POV OF THE SECURITY OFFICE

quote: What?
scene: 6    INT. PROMENADE - POV OF THE SECURITY OFFICE

quote: Nog made it for me. Boy's always been clever with his hands.
scene: 6    INT. PROMENADE - POV OF THE SECURITY OFFICE

quote: ... my storeroom.
scene: 6    INT. PROMENADE - POV OF THE SECURITY OFFICE

quote: Time this, Brother; you'll be very proud.
scene: 6    INT. PROMENADE - POV OF THE SECURITY OFFICE

quote: ... my storeroom.
scene: 6    INT. PROMENADE - POV OF THE SECURITY OFFICE

quote: Thief. Don't deny it. You've been stealing from me...
Brother, I'd never...
Tomorrow morning, I'm changing my entire lock system.
Four in... two up... here... it's behind this one...
Keep an eye on the Promenade...
... while I burn off the panel.
The glare could attract attention. I have a better idea.
A better idea.
I took the liberty of bringing along a small vial of magnasite drops...
Magnasite drops? What are magnasite drops?
A compound that will eat through duranium... one on each corner and the panel will fall off...
How do you know that?
When you were in the Gamma Quadrant overnight... we did very good business... naturally, I had to keep your profits safe. But you had the only key to the latinum floor vault.
You got into my latinum floor vault with... ... that?
I didn't want to tell you because then you'd know I'd burned off your floor plates. But I replaced them out of my own salary, Brother...
... my vault...
Should I take it out for you?
Don't touch it. Don't you touch anything. Ever; ever; again.
Just a piece of paper... ?
A treasure map, perhaps?
What does it mean, brother?
I have no idea.
Eight names. All of them Bajoran...
I want a picture of this list before I reseal the box. Go; get me an imager. Go.
You can't be in here; we're closed... Well, if you really want a drink...
She sent you, didn't she...
She knew you couldn't resist opening it. Sorry.
Yeah. Me too.
Brother!
Brother?... Help!
Somebody, help!
My brother's been killed!

I don't know! I don't Ten cc's of cortolin... know! I want an anti-grav lift in here, stat... ready the cortical stimulator... (repeating a question he's asked once already, to anyone as he works) ... what kind of weapon... I'm waiting for an answer...

character: know!I want an anti-grav lift in
quote: here, stat... ready the cortical stimulator... (repeating a question he's asked once already, to anyone as he works) ... what kind of weapon... I'm waiting for an answer...
cortical stimulator... (repeating a question he's asked once already, to anyone as he works) ... what kind of weapon... I'm waiting for an answer...
(repeating a question he's asked once already, to anyone as he works) ... what kind of weapon... I'm waiting for an answer...
question he's asked once already, to anyone as he works) ... what kind of weapon... I'm waiting for an answer...
asked once already, to anyone as he works) ... what kind of weapon... I'm waiting for an answer...
already, to anyone as he works) ... what kind of weapon... I'm waiting for an answer...
to anyone as he works) ... what kind of weapon... I'm waiting for an answer...
works) ... what kind of weapon... I'm waiting for an answer...
... what kind of weapon... I'm waiting for an answer...
I'm waiting for an answer...
I can't confirm it, Doctor... but whatever it was had to get by the scanners... My best guess is a compressed tetryon beam weapon...
(nods, working feverishly) Okay. Okay. That's consistent with what I'm seeing... Get the stimulator over here...
Doctor... ?
Thoracic cavity ruptured. Extensive neural trauma.
Now! Rom says it was a robbery attempt.
ODO Increase five percent. He says he doesn't know. But he knows.
Security's stopping everyone at the airlocks... but it took them five minutes to get in position... the assailant may already be on a ship...
Delay outgoing vessels We've got to get him to as long as you can... surgery... help me get him advise their respective up here... security details...
He's dying, isn't he? He's dying. What am I going to do if my brother dies?
Do? Oh, you'll have a lot to do. Once this place is yours.
But if he dies... Mine?
"Wives serve, brothers inherit." Rule of Acquisition number one hundred thirty-nine, if I'm not mistaken.
I hadn't thought of that.
Really. I had. Because, it's a solid motive for murder.
Yes, actually, I have heard of a few untimely deaths that seemed... wait a minute, you're not suggesting that I...
I've had my eye on you for a long time, Rom. You're not as stupid as you look.
I am too. I would never...
Constable, it's his own brother...
My own brother...
I hardly think...
Stay out of this, Commander. I know these Ferengi. They'd sell their own flesh and blood for a Cardassian groat...
Odo, he's a family friend. His son is very close to my boy...
Well, you'd better tell his son that Dad's going to the lunar prison on Meldrar One. Two hundred degrees in the shade.
I didn't. It's not true. Oh, irony of ironies. I finally get the bar and I'm falsely accused of my brother's murder.
Rom, as a friend, if you know anything that might be helpful, I think you should tell us...
It was a list. The man who shot my brother stole a list.
What kind of list?
Of names. Eight Bajoran names. It was in this box we... we found...
Found... ?
In a manner of speaking...
My brother was hired by someone on Bajor to retrieve it.
Who?
He didn't tell me. He never told me anything. I tried so hard to earn Quark's trust. Now he's dead. And I can never earn his trust.
Just his share of the profits.
I swear I don't know who hired him. All I know is that the box had been hidden years ago...
How many years ago?
I'm not sure. When the Cardassians were here. When the ship's store used to be the chemist shop.
The... chemist shop... ?
That's right.
Here? This is where you found the box?
Behind a duranium wall panel. I'll show you which one.
Do you want me to open it? I can do it in ten seconds...
You asked to see me?
Yes, yes, please come in. We've met before. Gul Dukat.
Have we?
I don't expect you'd remember. I was one of the guests at the reception. At the Bajoran Center for Science... it must have been two years ago.
Ah yes, when the Cardassian High Command was invited to... view me.
You were very amusing that night.
Was I.
You did a Cardassian neck trick that brought the house down.
The Bajoran scientist who worked with me thought you might find it entertaining. He made me practice for weeks on the... Cardassian neck trick.

Gul Hadar couldn't stop talking about it. He wanted to send you out to entertain the troops. I, on the other hand, began to wonder if you couldn't provide a more valuable service to the Cardassian Empire. I've stayed informed about you, Odo... since you walked out on your Bajoran keepers.
I simply felt I could learn more outside a laboratory.
Yes, you've become something of a student of humanoid nature, haven't you...
Just what is it you need, Gul Dukat?
Ever seen a dead man before?
Yes. In your mines.
Those were casualties. This is murder. I've decided you're going to investigate it.
Me? Why me? I'm no investigator.
But I have a suspicion you'd make a good one. Shape-shifting your way into places the rest of us can't go...
I have no intention of being a Cardassian agent.
Not an agent. An investigator.
There's a difference... ?
We can't have these Bajorans running around, murdering each other. I'm talking about order. Justice.
There is very little justice in the Cardassian occupation of Bajor.
(breaking character, harsh) Don't push me, Odo. My superiors would have me "solve" this murder by choosing ten Bajorans at random and executing them! I am hoping you'll give me a better alternative.
Now, these Bajorans won't talk to us... but they seem to trust you... I understand you used to sort out local disputes in some Bajoran village or other.
Now and then.
And as I've heard it, you do the same for our Bajoran laborers here on the station. Petty disputes in the barracks over food, blankets, everyday things like that... They come to you.
I suppose I'm considered a neutral observer.
Of course. You're not one of them. And you should be thankful for it. So here's another petty dispute. Only this time I'm bringing it to you. Find the murderer.
Are there any witnesses?
Sorry to keep you waiting, Mrs. Vaatrik.
scene: 24   INT. STORAGE ROOM/SECURITY OFFICE - CLOSE ON PALLRA

quote: This is Odo. He'll be investigating your husband's death. Perhaps you two already know each other.
scene: 24   INT. STORAGE ROOM/SECURITY OFFICE - CLOSE ON PALLRA

quote: Have you been in the shop... ?
scene: 24   INT. STORAGE ROOM/SECURITY OFFICE - CLOSE ON PALLRA

quote: No. I don't use chemicals.
scene: 24   INT. STORAGE ROOM/SECURITY OFFICE - CLOSE ON PALLRA

quote: I've assigned this space to you. We'll get you anything you need. Good hunting. My sympathies, Madame.
scene: 24   INT. STORAGE ROOM/SECURITY OFFICE - CLOSE ON PALLRA

quote: I'm sorry for your loss.
scene: 24   INT. STORAGE ROOM/SECURITY OFFICE - CLOSE ON PALLRA

quote: Thank you.
scene: 24   INT. STORAGE ROOM/SECURITY OFFICE - CLOSE ON PALLRA

quote: Do you have any idea who might have done this?
scene: 24   INT. STORAGE ROOM/SECURITY OFFICE - CLOSE ON PALLRA

quote: I have a very good idea.
scene: 24   INT. STORAGE ROOM/SECURITY OFFICE - CLOSE ON PALLRA

quote: You do...
scene: 24   INT. STORAGE ROOM/SECURITY OFFICE - CLOSE ON PALLRA

quote: May I be honest with you... ?
scene: 24   INT. STORAGE ROOM/SECURITY OFFICE - CLOSE ON PALLRA

quote: That might be helpful.
scene: 24   INT. STORAGE ROOM/SECURITY OFFICE - CLOSE ON PALLRA

quote: My husband was having an affair. Some girl came on the station about a week ago. He was... infatuated with her, I don't know... Why are men like that?
scene: 24   INT. STORAGE ROOM/SECURITY OFFICE - CLOSE ON PALLRA

quote: Believe me, I have no idea.
scene: 24   INT. STORAGE ROOM/SECURITY OFFICE - CLOSE ON PALLRA

quote: We had two wonderful years together... until she arrived and now... (sighs, angry, shaking her head)
scene: 24   INT. STORAGE ROOM/SECURITY OFFICE - CLOSE ON PALLRA

quote: You loved him very much.
scene: 24   INT. STORAGE ROOM/SECURITY OFFICE - CLOSE ON PALLRA

quote: Of course I did.
scene: 24   INT. STORAGE ROOM/SECURITY OFFICE - CLOSE ON PALLRA

quote: Then, perhaps you might explain something I don't understand.
scene: 24   INT. STORAGE ROOM/SECURITY OFFICE - CLOSE ON PALLRA

quote: What's that?
scene: 24   INT. STORAGE ROOM/SECURITY OFFICE - CLOSE ON PALLRA

quote: Mister Vaatrik was found dead two hours ago. Mrs. Vaatrik hasn't shed a tear.
scene: 24   INT. STORAGE ROOM/SECURITY OFFICE - CLOSE ON PALLRA

quote: What makes you think...
scene: 24   INT. STORAGE ROOM/SECURITY OFFICE - CLOSE ON PALLRA

quote: By necessity I'm an observer, Mrs. Vaatrik. When a humanoid cries, the epidermis below the eyes swells noticeably. Your epidermis is perfectly normal.
scene: 24   INT. STORAGE ROOM/SECURITY OFFICE - CLOSE ON PALLRA

quote: I'm too angry to cry. The shock...
scene: 24   INT. STORAGE ROOM/SECURITY OFFICE - CLOSE ON PALLRA

quote: Of course. So you were about to
scene: 24   INT. STORAGE ROOM/SECURITY OFFICE - CLOSE ON PALLRA

quote: He had confessed his indiscretion to me days ago but said it was over...
scene: 24   INT. STORAGE ROOM/SECURITY OFFICE - CLOSE ON PALLRA

quote: And when he broke it off with her, she killed him in a jealous rage.
scene: 24   INT. STORAGE ROOM/SECURITY OFFICE - CLOSE ON PALLRA

quote: Something like that.
scene: 24   INT. STORAGE ROOM/SECURITY OFFICE - CLOSE ON PALLRA

quote: Do you know her name?
scene: 24   INT. STORAGE ROOM/SECURITY OFFICE - CLOSE ON PALLRA

quote: No, but I can point her out to you.
scene: 24   INT. STORAGE ROOM/SECURITY OFFICE - CLOSE ON PALLRA

quote: When was the last time you saw Mister Vaatrik alive?
At dinner. He went back to the shop to do some inventory work afterwards.
You don't live in community quarters.
No. We were lucky enough to be assigned a private room... I guess because we ran the shop... at least we had a little privacy... (Odo grunts an acknowledgement) There... that's her...
Odo?
We haven't picked up anyone at the airlocks. I can't hold up outbound traffic any longer...
scene: 29   INT. PROMENADE - REGULAR LIGHTS - ANGLE FAVORING

quote: I'm sure he disposed of the weapon before he left.
scene: 29   INT. PROMENADE - REGULAR LIGHTS - ANGLE FAVORING

quote: I heard about the list... ... the one that Quark got out of the wall...
scene: 29   INT. PROMENADE - REGULAR LIGHTS - ANGLE FAVORING

quote: Rom said it had been hidden there during the occupation.
scene: 29   INT. PROMENADE - REGULAR LIGHTS - ANGLE FAVORING

quote: I couldn't help wondering if it had... something to do with Vaatrik...
scene: 29   INT. PROMENADE - REGULAR LIGHTS - ANGLE FAVORING

quote: I've been wondering the same thing.
scene: 29   INT. PROMENADE - REGULAR LIGHTS - ANGLE FAVORING

quote: Security log, Stardate 47284.1. In this job, there is no unfinished business.
The assault on Quark reopens a five- year-old murder case that I've never, not for a moment, closed. Patience is a lost virtue to most. To me, an ally.
I barely saw it... I'm sorry... I don't remember any of the names...
All right... all right... let's just... relax a moment...
I really ought to be getting back to my bar...
He's not dead yet, Rom.
They're not keeping him alive by artificial means, are they... my brother wouldn't want that...
No, he's clinging to life all on his own.
Typical.
All right, let's try again... Close your eyes...
Take a deep breath, clear your mind of everything in it... if there's anything there... breathe...
Now what do you see...
The bar...
Yes.
With my name on it.
The past, Rom. Not the future. The box opens. There's a piece of paper in it...
Yes, yes, I see it...
Quark unfolds it... there's a list of names... Bajoran names... the one at the very top catches your eye... and the first letter is...
"C!" It's a "C."
And the next letter is...
Uh...uh...
Skip to the last letter in the name, Rom...
"O!" It's an "O."
Starts with a "C," ends with an "O."
And... and... there's a mark in the name...
An apostrophe...
Ches'so!
You're sure?
Yes. Maybe.
Maybe.
It's something like Ches'so. I think.
Call me day or night if you remember something else...
Anything?
Ches'so...
Might be the first name on the list. Remember anyone from those days on the station with that name?
No, but I wasn't here very long.
So I recall.
We've never talked about it.
We never had to.
I would have been executed.
You were innocent of the crime I was investigating.
That wouldn't have mattered to the Cardassians.
It mattered to me.
Do you mind if I join you?
A pretty girl like you shouldn't be eating alone.
I don't do whatever it is you want. Not for money. Not for food.
No, you misunderstand... I'm sorry, of course I can see how you could... let me start over...
Are you some kind of a security officer?
How did you know that?
You are, aren't you.
Unofficially, I suppose that's true.
"Unofficially?" What does that mean?
Gul Dukat asked me to investigate the murder of a Bajoran man named Vaatrik. I understand you knew him.
(not trying to lie well) Who says I did...
His widow.
I suppose she told you I killed him...
Did you?
No.
On the contrary, you were in love with him.
No.
But he was in love with you.
No.
It doesn't sound like much of a romance.
We weren't having a romance.
Then, why would he tell his wife you were?
You'll have to ask him.
If you were having an affair, I promise you I'll find out about it.

All you're going to find is that I've been here for two weeks. I met the man just after I arrived. He had Pyrellian ginger tea... I don't know where he managed to get it. But I like ginger tea. We got to be friends. Maybe he was attracted to me. It never went anywhere.
You're suggesting this affair was all in his head.
Or she's lying to you. She rarely tells the truth.
How do you know that?
He told me.
What else did he tell you?
More than you ever want to know about the life of a chemist.
Why do you think Dukat wanted you on
I'm sure he had good reasons.
Why not his own security people?
No Bajoran would talk to them.
That's never stopped the Cardassians before. They have ways of getting information. Something to think about.
Where were you last night?
At the bar... I heard the Ferengi are allowed to hire some Bajorans for the dog work. Better than the mines.
You haven't spent any time in the mines.
How do you know that?
Your hands.
You're not bad at this... you're right, my last job was in a replicator plant on Bajor.
You're not allowed to quit those jobs. What happened?
I hit a supervisor... who tried what I thought you were trying a few minutes ago.
I appreciate your restraint this time. You're not planning on leaving the station soon...
If I were, would you have the Cardassians stop me?
Yes.
Then, I'm not planning on leaving the station soon.
I'll tell you something...
"Unofficially" or not, you're working for the Cardassians. Sooner or later, you're going to have to decide whose side your on.
I don't choose "sides."
Everybody has to choose sides... Constable.
Goodnight.
Trust me. You have nothing to worry about.
There were just a few more questions...
I was... just about to take a bath...
I could come back later...
No... no, that's all right, come in...
I don't know what you're talking about.
You knew nothing about a list.
Nothing.
Why would your husband have hidden a list of Bajoran names?
I can't imagine why. Are you sure it was him?
No.
Maybe the Cardassians put it there. Before they left.
Someone on Bajor told Quark where to find it.
I wish I could help. I sort of liked that little Ferengi.
Don't write his eulogy yet. He's still with us.
I thought you said...
He was shot. At point blank range. The Federation doctor saved his life.
Good for him.
Does the name "Ches'so" mean anything to you?
I don't think so. Who is it?
Just someone I'd like to talk to.
Thank you for seeing me.
If this has anything to do with my husband's murder, I want to help in any way I can.
Oh, there was one other thing... I understand your power was recently terminated for lack of payment.
That's right.
But you were able to transfer funds to the power company this morning.
I don't appreciate your looking into my private affairs.
It's just part of a routine investigation. If you could tell me where you got the money.
A loan from a friend.
Of course. Your friend's name?
Odo, this really has nothing to do with your investigation...
(smiles as best he can) Good, then you won't mind giving me the name.
I'm sorry. My "friend" is... married. I won't drag him into this.
Security Log, supplemental. The Ferengi holds on to life like it's gold-pressed latinum.
scene: 44   INT. INFIRMARY - CLOSE ON QUARK'S UNCONSCIOUS FACE

quote: The next several hours will tell the story... we've done everything we can for him...
scene: 44   INT. INFIRMARY - CLOSE ON QUARK'S UNCONSCIOUS FACE

quote: Maybe he just doesn't want his brother to get the bar. Or maybe he knows he's the only real witness I have.
scene: 44   INT. INFIRMARY - CLOSE ON QUARK'S UNCONSCIOUS FACE

quote: I've got some good news and some bad news.
scene: 44   INT. INFIRMARY - CLOSE ON QUARK'S UNCONSCIOUS FACE

quote: I think I've found our Ches'so.
scene: 44   INT. INFIRMARY - CLOSE ON QUARK'S UNCONSCIOUS FACE

quote: Who is he?
scene: 44   INT. INFIRMARY - CLOSE ON QUARK'S UNCONSCIOUS FACE

quote: A Bajoran mining engineer... he's been very active in charity work for the war orphans...
scene: 44   INT. INFIRMARY - CLOSE ON QUARK'S UNCONSCIOUS FACE

quote: What makes you think he's our man?
scene: 44   INT. INFIRMARY - CLOSE ON QUARK'S UNCONSCIOUS FACE

quote: Some connections from my past suggested he might be. His work brought him to the station a lot.
scene: 44   INT. INFIRMARY - CLOSE ON QUARK'S UNCONSCIOUS FACE

quote: The bad news is he's dead. Drowned in a pond on his property last night.
scene: 44   INT. INFIRMARY - CLOSE ON QUARK'S UNCONSCIOUS FACE

quote: I'm responsible...
scene: 44   INT. INFIRMARY - CLOSE ON QUARK'S UNCONSCIOUS FACE

quote: How?
scene: 44   INT. INFIRMARY - CLOSE ON QUARK'S UNCONSCIOUS FACE

quote: I mentioned the name "Ches'so" to the Vaatrik woman. If she recognized it as "Ches'saro," and thought he might lead us to her... Security to the Infirmary.
scene: 44   INT. INFIRMARY - CLOSE ON QUARK'S UNCONSCIOUS FACE

quote: Acknowledged.
scene: 44   INT. INFIRMARY - CLOSE ON QUARK'S UNCONSCIOUS FACE

quote: Major, I need some help. Advise the Medical Examiner that I want a complete autopsy on Ches'sarro, and that his death is to be treated as a suspected homicide. I'll need the communication records for the Vaatrik home for the past fifty-two hours... and have the central bank keep a supervisor on duty all night... I'll need several bank records as well...
scene: 44   INT. INFIRMARY - CLOSE ON QUARK'S UNCONSCIOUS FACE

quote: Whose?
scene: 44   INT. INFIRMARY - CLOSE ON QUARK'S UNCONSCIOUS FACE

quote: I don't know yet.
scene: 44   INT. INFIRMARY - CLOSE ON QUARK'S UNCONSCIOUS FACE

quote: I want round the clock armed security on Quark. No visitors.
scene: 44   INT. INFIRMARY - CLOSE ON QUARK'S UNCONSCIOUS FACE

quote: Yessir.
scene: 44   INT. INFIRMARY - CLOSE ON QUARK'S UNCONSCIOUS FACE

quote: Stop by one of the holosuites... two programs for the price of one.
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: I'm looking for the proprietor of this establishment.
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: Does he owe you money?
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: No.
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: Are you here to arrest him?
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: No.
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: Then you've found him. Quark. At your service. First drink on the house. An old and dreadful Cardassian tradition. What'll you have.
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: I don't drink.
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: A soft drink then...
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: I don't drink.
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: I guess that's why we don't see you around here much...
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: I'd like to ask you a few questions about the death of the Bajoran chemist...
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: Wait a minute... you're the shape- shifter... you're the one who's working for Dukat...
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: I'm not working for Dukat. (beat, of course he is and he knows it) I'm just trying to solve a murder.
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: No, I've heard about you... you do some Cardassian neck trick, am I right?
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: Not anymore.
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: That could go over big in this room...
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: I'm checking the alibi of a young Bajoran woman, red hair, named Kira Nerys... she says she was here last night...
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: Yeah, I remember her. She wanted a job.
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: How long was she here?
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: Long enough.
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: Long enough for what?
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: You know.
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: No, I don't. Why don't you tell me.
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: She was showing me... her initiative.
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: Is that some sort of sexual reference?
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: These jobs are hard to come by. Her credentials were very impressive.
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: Hey, listen... listen here, what's the problem...
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: The problem is... you're lying.
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: You've got me all wrong.
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: I want the truth... or I'll just turn you over to Gul Dukat and he can get it for me...
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: Okay, fine... I didn't realize we were dealing with a murder here... she didn't pay me enough for that anyway...
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: She paid you for an alibi? (Quark shrugs an acknowledgement) I wonder how Gul Dukat will react when I tell him about that.
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: (sighs, talking to someone behind Odo) I'm sure it'll cost me a case of Cardassian ale.
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: Two cases at the very least.
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: A broken alibi. That sounds like progress. Is there someone you want me to arrest?
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: Not yet.
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: But soon. I need a name, Odo.
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: You'll get your name when I'm certain it's the right name.
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: Listen to how he speaks to me, Quark. You're not afraid of anyone, are you, shape-shifter? Not even me. (Odo looks at him evenly) I was right about you... you are the man for this job.
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: Listen, I feel you and I... we've gotten off to a bad start here... let me make it up to you... you need anything? A little ginger tea, no, you don't drink...
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: Chocolate, maybe... companionship... ?
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: You look like you just lost your best friend, Constable.
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: Is Quark...
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: Quark is stable.
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: What's this?
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: The list.
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: You found it?
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: No, I assembled it. From the Vaatrik woman's communication records. She's been talking to each of these people a lot. Odd thing is she'd never talked to any of them... until two days ago.
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: When the list was stolen.
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: Interestingly, every one of them transferred exactly one hundred thousand Bajoran litas into her bank accounts during the last twenty-six hours...
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: Blackmail?
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: Blackmail.
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: What did they have to hide?
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: For one thing, that they had come out of the occupation with this kind of money...
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: You think they were working with the Cardassians...
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: Selling out their own world for a profit. Collaborators. Not even a Ferengi would do that. It explains a lot of things.
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: Do you have enough to charge her?
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: Not yet. I'd like to bring her in for questioning. With your permission, I'll have the local Bajoran authorities transport her here...
scene: 49   INT. QUARK'S - ON QUARK LAUGHING, BEHIND THE BAR

quote: Nobody ever had to teach me the "Justice Trick." That's just something I know. A racial memory from my species, I guess. It's really the only clue I have to what kind of people they are. Are these kinds of thoughts appropriate for a Starfleet log? I don't care.
scene: A56   INT. PROMENADE - NIGHT LIGHTING - WIDE SHOT

quote: There's no room in Justice for loyalty or friendship or love... Justice, as the humans like to say, is blind. I used to believe that. I'm not sure I can anymore.
Yes, I lied about my alibi... but that doesn't make me a killer...
Where were you when he was murdered?
Asleep. Alone.
No one saw you in the community quarters.
I wasn't there... I've found a small corner in the...
You're lying.
Don't bother... your whole face changes... I should have seen it before... you don't lie well...
Thanks.
So why don't you start telling the truth.
(dark, still soft, almost to herself) Whose side are you going to be on, Constable... ?
I'm not going to play your game.
Once I tell you the truth, you'll have to choose.

No. No, that's why I was given this job. That's why all of you always come to me with problems. I'm the outsider. I'm on no one's side. All I'm interested in is justice. If you're innocent, you'll go free. If you're not, I'll turn you over to Cardassian authorities. That's the only choice here.
I didn't kill him. When he was killed I was on Level Twenty-one...
Twenty-one? Ore processing?
Check the Cardassian security logs. You'll find a breach on Twenty-one last night...
I'm in the Bajoran underground. I came here to commit acts of sabotage against the Cardassians. Last night, I succeeded.
The ore processor was damaged by a sub-nucleonic device at twenty-five hundred hours last night... it's out of operation for two weeks...
That'll give the mine workers a little time off at least. I'll describe the device I used if you still don't believe me.
That's why you needed an alibi from Quark...
None of this will matter to the Cardassians if you tell them the truth. I'll be executed for the sabotage. Who cares about Bajorans killing Bajorans when you can hang a rebel...
Is this her?
I told you when I have the...
Is this her.
No.
You can go.
If you're lying, shape-shifter...
If you know as much about me as you say you do, Dukat... you know I don't lie. I'm convinced that she did not kill Vaatrik.
Is it too late for visitors?
I'm sorry, sir... no visitors are permitted here.
Oh, I see. Then, perhaps you could just put these in water for him.
Of course...
Odo to Bashir. Report immediately to the Infirmary.
On my way.
It's over, Rom. Over. You're a hero.
I am?
You saved your brother's life.
I've never seen him before in my life.
Really. Your communications records show you've made several calls to his home. And received several as well.
You also transferred a large sum of money into his account two days ago.
I want to confer with my advocate.
Of course. I'll make arrangements for you to speak with him. In the meantime, the two of you can introduce yourselves to one another.
I don't care what you think you know, shape-shifter. You'll never be able to prove that I killed my husband. Because I didn't.
I know.
When did you realize?
The possibility occurred to me when you got the name Ches'sarro so quickly... Your friends from the underground must have already suspected him of being a collaborator...

Once I knew the eight names were a list of collaborators... the murder of Vaatrik made sense for the first time. He must have been a collaborator too. He had the money for ginger tea. He had the private quarters. I've never had a motive for his murder until now. He kept his wife in relative luxury. She surely wouldn't have killed him. So, who would kill a Cardassian collaborator? Someone in the Bajoran underground, of course.
One of my colleagues was given the job to sabotage the ore processor. Vaatrik was my responsibility.
You were here to execute him.
No. I was here to find the list. The names of the Bajorans who were selling us out. We'd been informed that Vaatrik was their direct link to Dukat.
... That must have been why Dukat chose me to investigate. He had to stay as far away from this incident as he could... so he wouldn't endanger his network of Bajoran sympathizers.
Obviously, I never found the list. But that's what I was looking for in the shop when he walked in on me. I didn't have any choice.
I misjudged you, Major. You were a better liar than I gave you credit for.
You were working for the Cardassians.
I haven't been for more than a year. You've had all that time to tell me the truth.
(very softly; defenseless) I tried to tell you the truth a hundred times. What you think of me... matters a lot. I was afraid...
... it might affect our friendship?
Maybe it doesn't have to.
Will you ever be able to trust me the same way again?
Interceptor One... ?
The Skrreean ship exploded. I didn't even think we hit it...
The phaser beam must've ignited the radiation leak...
Commander... I'm so sorry...
We all are, General...
I just came by to wish you luck on Draylon Two.
Haneek, I still believe this is the best choice... for Bajor and for you.
And you believe we would have been a burden to your people...
Yes.

(nods; it's the answer she expected) I think you've made a terrible mistake. All of you. Maybe we could have helped you. Maybe we could have helped each other. The Skrreeans are farmers, Kira. You have a famine on your planet. We might have made that peninsula bloom again. We'll never know, will we?
Fifty years of Cardassian rule has made you all frightened and suspicious. I feel sorry for you.
You were right. Bajor is not Kentanna.
What if I say something dumb? Something that makes him uncomfortable?
Like what?
Like... "How's your new leg?"
I think he's probably expecting a few questions.
I just don't want to say the wrong thing.
You'll be fine. But maybe I shouldn't be there when he arrives.
Why?

Well... when he was in the hospital, he didn't answer any of my letters -- that's okay. I mean, I'm only his stepmother. He's going through something so personal... maybe he only wants his real family around.
You are real family.

That's right. And you should both just relax. Yes, Nog has lost a leg and that's a traumatic experience. But you're not going to say or do anything that'll be worse than what he's already gone through. Just be happy to see him and tell him you love him. For today, that'll be enough.
They've docked.
You sure this is the right transport, colonel?
I checked the passenger list this morning. He definitely boarded at --
Nog!
Welcome home! We love you! You look great! It's so good to have you back! Welcome back! The station wasn't the same without you! Etc.
Uh... thank you. It's good to be back. My orders, captain.
Medical leave? How can that be?
Sounds like an excuse to loaf around while the rest of us are working.
Work and lots of it, that's my prescription.
The Defiant plasma conduits could use an overhaul.
My drink replicator could use some work.
Captain, maybe he forged those orders.
I'm afraid they're genuine. Ensign Nog has no duties until further notice. Except... to attend a welcome home party in the wardroom!
If it's all the same to you, sir... I'm pretty tired. I'd rather just... go to my quarters. Is that all right?
